Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Model_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for 3 nights at the end of a recent family holiday. There are so many reasons to recommend this hotel I thought the easiest way to sum up the hotel is to do a list of pro's and con's:- Pro's:- 1.) You can self park for free. 2.) It has a great and reasonably priced cafe - everything purchased was top notch - It also gives a cheaper alternative to breakfast if you don't want to eat lots. 3.) It's very family friendly. 4.) The Espresso Coffee machine in the room is by far the best coffee machine I've ever had in a hotel. 5.) There's no resort fee, as is charged in many other high class resorts. 6.) The staff are exceptionally friendly and professional. 7.) The rooms are very classy and immaculately clean. 8.) The beds are extremely comfortable. 9.) The pools are all heated and refreshments are served at the poolside. 10.) The grounds are large and are safe and excellent for family walks. 11.) There's lots to do for all the family - Horse Riding/Tennis/Swimming/Hikes/Special Events arranged by the hotel - in our case an egg hunt for the kids on Easter Sunday. 12.) Great Restaurant - We ate in Amaya and found it was excellent. 13.) Free Raspberry Lemonade (Tasted amazing!) / Peach Lemonade was served with biscuits in the lobby area from 3-5pm each day for free - a very nice touch! 14.) Free coffee was served by the concierge desk in the morning before 9am. 15.) Free Wifi. Con's:- 1.) It's expensive (But in my opinion worth it!). 2.) It's a drive away from Downtown San Diego. 3.) The activities are a bit on the pricey side. I would recommend the Grand Del Mar without hesitation as one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I will definately stay here again next time I visit California. A list of the complimentry amenities included in the room price is provided below:- The following amenities and services are included in your rate: •In-room wired and wireless Internet access •Courtesy transportation within a 14-mile radius (from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm, based on availability) •The Grand Beach Service – includes roundtrip transportation to/from Del Mar's 18th Street beach; set-up of beach chairs and umbrellas; beach towels and bottled waters •Saturday morning canyon to waterfall guided hike •Fitness classes and fitness center use •Local and 800 number calls •In-room bottled waters and espresso machines •Concierge services •Twice-daily housekeeping service •Overnight shoeshine •Daily newspaper delivery – choice at check-in •Self Parking

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Zain214
Reviews.Content: I was initially reluctant to write a review of the Grand Del Mar, because I don't believe that my words could possibly do this incredible resort justice. It is hard to capture the essence of this place in a review. This has to be one of the best hotels in America. I have stayed at Four Seasons, Ritz-Carltons and other five star resorts through out the country and have never experienced more sincere and exemplary service. Every staff member was warm, friendly, and willing to go above and beyond to meet our needs. The grounds are unbelievably beautiful and serene. Within moments of arriving there, I could feel the stresses and anxieties of everyday life start to melt away. This is a very upscale and luxurious hotel and initally I was afraid that it may be a snooty environment. It was anything but. I traveled with my three children and we were made to feel very comfortable and welcome. We dressed casually and never felt out of place. Some specific details about the hotel that may help as you make your travel plans are: * Very kid friendly and loads of kids activities. My kids simply loved the explorers club. However, we stayed during spring break and the place was teeming with children. I get the sense that there may be significantly less kids during off-peak times * several complimentary daily activities. We did a guided canyon to waterfall hike and a fantastic zumba class * The resort is not in a walkable area, however there is complimentary transportation to the beach and within a 14 mile radius of the hotel In conclusion, This is an amazing resort. It will exceed your highest expectations. The property is gorgeous and immaculate and the service is genuinely friendly and exceptional. I hope I get the opportunity to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Elegance and a hotel that sweats the small stuff”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: After a massive tour of SF, Santa Cruz, LA and then San Diego, the highlight of the trip was the oasis called The Grand Del Mar. San Diego is a great spot, and coming to a hotel that understands its location, surroundings and most importantly guests personas makes the premier hotel in the North SD area. Tucked away in Carmel Valley, this gem on the side of the hill, surrounded by an amazing golf course is like an onion you peel away and find better and better layers as you dive deeper. Location is one of the best in SD. Not too far for exploring and close to Torrey Pines and the best beaches in SD. Also you miss a lot of the "merge" of the 805 and 5 traffic. Hospitality is top notch. Service is super-friendly, not pretentious and everyone from the front desk to housekeeping was ultra friendly. I give this place the US - Uber-Service award. Smiles everywhere, and great attitudes. Amenities are outstanding. from the mango lemonade and cookies at reception to the chocolate covered Oreos at night by your bed. Rose pedals, complementary bottled water in your room and so much more. They really don't miss anything here and it seems so natural. One of the best beds I have slept in and the only thing I would suggest is that they upgrade the flat panel signal to HD. Food in the downstairs restaurant was excellent for breakfast and the complementary coffee in the little and yet very well stocked cafe area was a welcomed treat at 6:30a when reading the paper overlooking the adult pool. Yes there are many pools and activities, like a great spa, gym etc. Lastly I will say that I had the pleasure of staying here once before when Vh1 Divas was held in San Diego. This hotel gets even better with age, and it was GREAT for Divas!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Luxury at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBees8
Reviews.Content: No matter how highly I or anybody else write a review about the absolute best resort possible, it will not serve The Grand Del Mar justice. One truly must experience The Grand Del Mar for themselves to get an idea and appreciate every detail and care that is exerted from the architecture, to the well manicured grounds, fine dining experience and etiquette of the refined staff. Yes, the rates may seem hefty but for the quality of just about everything it is money worthy spent. This is definitely a place to spoil yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around was even better!”
Reviews.Author: pineappleprincess92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past month for a week, and thoroughly enjoyed it!! We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago, but the service has definitely improved. We stayed at the Prada Suite and loved the space!! The housekeeping was very good-rooms were clean and the personal touches were nice. The baths were huge and the showers were nice. They could improve on their amenities though... I loved the bed-huge and super comfy!! The pool was nice-although not sure why the jacuzzi was so small. They have speakers underwater, so you can hear music while swimming!! We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: WarrenMuir
Reviews.Content: Having read a few reviews before staying I was concerned that it wouldn't live up to expectations. It did, easily! The property was stunning and our suite bigger than my first apartment. The service was another level with every small detail taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “All the best”
Reviews.Author: patricia p
Reviews.Content: Nothing but the best here.. Service,amenities, staff. The only problem is how inferior other place seem in comparison. I could not have had a better stay anywhere. Heated pool, the yoga classes, all the resturants were the best possible.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: LunaJ
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for 6 nights recently. We booked a Prado Suite, and our experience was excellent. The room was spacious and had everything we needed - confortable beds, large bathrooms, spacious closets, ample drawers for clothes, good bar content. Daily maid service was impressive - we left some charge cords on the floor and when we returned the cords were nicely bundled up, tied together with ribbon. Rooms service was timely and well presented. Restaurants were good too - Amaya has a very nice outside area and it is pleasant to eat outside. Addison was also nice - the food was good (portions a little on the small side), and the wine list was impressive. Horseback riding was also a great experience! Overall a great hotel that we will definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand was indeed Grand”
Reviews.Author: x10effect
Reviews.Content: WOW, is all I can say about this incredible hotel and course. From the moment I got there the door staff were friendly and greeted me nicely, it cont'd at reception and even to the guy who showed me to my room... This staff really care. All smiles and they will walk you to wherever you're going it was great. Best hotel I've ever stayed in and I travel around the world about 4 times per year, so I stay in a lot of hotels. The food is great, free internet that works all over the hotel, royal rooms, fresh clean towels. Loved it and can't wait to come back to san diego just to stay here with my partner. The spa is awesome too, had a massage and for $25 used the sauna, spa and hang out room. The other great thing is seminar rooms. Cheers Grand crew and management for an awesome experience. Steven

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Five Star Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: In October I stayed at Caesar’s Palace and the Bellagio in Las Vegas. The Grand Del Mar in San Diego far surpasses either in luxury, comfort, and service. As I drove in I greeted the guard at the property entrance. I was amazed when the valet greeted me with, “hello Dr. Brown.” I later learned they call ahead for each new guest. Talk about making you feel at home! I could only find two very slight damages in my room. I briefly mentioned those inconsequential loose finishes to management in a chance encounter at dinner and was stunned to find that both had been corrected by engineering as I dined. There is not a leaf out of place anywhere as I sit at the firepit just outside of my room writing this. This is truly a five star experience that surpasses the best of the best even in Las Vegas! --Dr. Scott Brown, Education Director, Investment U / Oxford Club

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: This is like stepping through the looking glass into perfect service heaven! The rooms and grounds are like a cross bewteen Roman god and Southern California cool I stay in a lot of four and five star resorts for my business, but this one is beyond description.. The staff is so good, so natural yet so professional without going overboard. The only problem was a restaurant recommendation at a place called Jake's in Del Mar. We had reservations, but waited an hour and never got a table. It was a real nightmare. Rude, stupid, unprofessional. It is hard to believe this hotel recommended this place. The concierge, as you would expect, made up for the blunder wonderfully. Avoid Jake's and the rest of your stay will be one of the best you'll ever have, ever! This hotel is absolute perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: beccadog
Reviews.Content: I don't travel a lot (mostly Europe and Caribbean); but when I do, I usually stay in nice places. However, The Grand del Mar in San Diego is the nicest place I’ve ever stayed. It is 4 years old, impeccably maintained and managed. The staff is wonderful and the amenities are superb. I am hesitant in using such adjectives but they’re all appropriate when writing a review of this place. It was great, seriously.

Reviews.Title: “You find yourself saying "The Best" a lot”
Reviews.Author: noclvrname
Reviews.Content: In these days of hyperbolic hyperbole it is hard to convincingly describe a truely superior property like the Grand Del Mar. It is simply flawless. The service is perfect from the moment you bring your car to the valet, then on to reception, then on to the bellmen, houskeeping and the waistaff in the restaurants as well as all the supporting staff of a great hotel, spa and resort. The folks in charge of this establishment have created a superb culture of service that is consistently rendered with dignity, a complete lack of obsequiesness, and perfect performance and timing. My wife and I are travelers, high end travelers. We only stay at 4 (reluctantly) and 5 star properties. We have been doing this for 30 years. We have been doing this all over the world. We love to travel. We love high end properties. We both agree that this may be, overall, all aspects considered, the best property we have ever stayed at. This takes some thought and a good memory. We spent an entire evening reviewing our experiences and the meals we have had. We may have missed something but we stand by the notion that the Grand is, as it's name implies, THE Grand. If you are wealthy - you have nothing to worry about - you can stay here anytime. If you are middle to upper middle class - stay here while you can. Once the economy recovers and the reputation of the Grand builds, you will be priced out of this particular piece of paradise. And do eat at one of the two wonderful restauarnts. While the food at Addisons was, as espected, fautless, it was not our style. We prefer Amaya - a truely first class culinary experience that is without the minimalism that comes with many of today's absolutely top culinary establishments (which Addison's surely is amongst.) So, if you want an esthetic wonder, piece and tranquility, a multitude of resort and spa activities and services, impecable food, somewhat austentatious but always in good taste surroundings all coupled with the world class San Diego climate give yourself a treat and stay here for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience all around.”
Reviews.Author: bmarkhasin
Reviews.Content: As a frequent global traveller, I have stayed in most of the premier hotel brands in multiple cities, but I must say that the Grand del Mar surpasses them all. Every aspect of this property is exceptional. We were immediately impressed by the level of personal service and recognition. When we drove up to the gates, the security guard inquired about our stay before directing up to the hotel. The valet knew our names from the note the security guard left under the wiper. The check-in attendant walked us to our room where our bags were already waiting with the bellhop who walked us through the room to introduce the ammenities and overall layout of the grounds. At the restaurant, the hostess inquired our names and actually remembered them throughout our stay. Wow... Our room was large, spacious and beautifully appointed with woods, granites and marble. Needless to say the room was spotless. There is a large flatscreen TV in the main room and a second small TV in the bathroom if you wanted to watch TV or listen to music in the bath. The closet was essentially a walk-in configuration. We had a third floor room with a balcony opening onto a court yard. The room was incredibly well insulated for noise. I'm sure we had neighbors, but I had no idea they were there, and we didnt pick up any outside noise through the heavy balcony doors. As a light sleeper, I can honestly say this was one of the best sleeps I ever had at a hotel. We were visiting over spring break, and the intent was to visit the several amusement / theme parks in the region. My son opted to skip Disneyland to chill-out at the hotel pool!! Now we have another reason to come back... The Grand del Mar is a golf resort. The grounds are immaculate and although we are not golfers, we were impressed with the course surrounding the hotel. Perhaps next time we visit, we will opt for lessons through their pro-shop. The hotel has 4 pools and two hot-tubs. One area is reserved for adults and cellphones are prohibited (discouraged), with a large pool, hot-tub and bar. The other area contains 3 pools including a shallow kids pool and a small hot-tub. This family area also has a full bar with meal service. The hotel offers a baby-sitting service while the adults go for a round of golf, and there is also a daily program for kids. For older kids / teens, there is of course golf, as well as tennis courts and an equestrian facility. Pony rides can apparently be arranged for small kids, while trail rides and even riding lessons are offered for older kids / teens. There is a spa which we didnt utilize on this trip. There are several restaurants on the grounds and a cafe / gift-shop. We dined at Amaya. Food quality and preparation was excellent. They have a vegetarian dinner menu and will make minor modifications to their dishes to suit guests tastes. The breakfast menu is more limited in terms of offering vegetarian or non-dairy options. Pool-side meal options were relatively extensive. As expected, the Grand is pricey, especially if you throw-in a bunch of activities and opt to dine on-site throughout your stay. But if you want to treat yourself to an experience, we recommend this property. We will be returning in the future, staying longer and trying out the activities we missed this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: This is an amzing place to stay. The service is impeccable, the room felt like a suite it was so spacious and beautifully decorated. The decor is sophisticated but still manages to be almost homey. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Short of Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: Whenever we check in at the Grand, we take a deep breath because we know we are "home." The resort grounds and rooms are utterly amazingly out of this world. It's hard to fathom that a resort of this size has less than 300 rooms, suites, and villas because the Grand emphasizes detail, impeccable customer service, and nothing short of making one's stay a perfect 10. We love the idea that the hotel remembers our favorite room so every time we come down, they immediately put us in that room. We come to San Diego now just to stay at the Grand Del Mar! From the time we arrive and the time we depart, there isn't a minute that we don't feel pampered or treated like royalty. So many staff members recognize us and address us personally which is hard to find these days at many large impersonal hotels. But then, the Grand Del Mar doesn't fall under that category because it is in a truly 5 star category of its own. This 390 million resort is one of a kind -- over 30 types of different rocks and over 30 types of different wood. Once you have stayed here, I guarantee you that you will not want to leave. At least, that is how we feel each time we are here because we have found our "paradise on earth."

Reviews.Title: “Hairstyle and Dinner”
Reviews.Author: Selina B
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Haim Salon my stylist was Katie. She gave me a cut and color. First of all Katie is the most adorable young lady. She was very professional and has the most wonderful personality. My hair has never looked this good!! I look like a new person, I wanted to dress up and go out with my husband!! He by the way loved my new look!! She is amazing!! My husband and I had dinner at Amaya and service there was spectacular! Ekrem came to our table and introduced himself making sure we were happy with our meal. The food was great but the service was what made our meal so good. My husband and I will deffinately return!! I will deffinately be returning to Katie! I don't want anyone else touching my hair!! Bravo to you and your staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gardenlad
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the nicest hotel inhave ever stayed in (and I have stayed in some nice ones). My room was incredible. The service was over the top in all areas of the hotel. The restaurant on the property served the best meal I have ever eaten. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Wow....what a place”
Reviews.Author: BTrun78
Reviews.Content: All the five star reviews about this fine hotel are accurate. Top notch in all respects. The rooms are superb, with a high intention to detail. All the additional amenities are the best, multiple pool options, the Fazio course is beautiful and extremely playable. Dining covers the entire landscape from a very high level to casual. Clearly, one of the top hotels in the west. You need to stay here and experience it....as someone who travels extensively this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “So lucky to have this magnificent hotel so close to home.”
Reviews.Author: Travelrella2011
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite spot! Golf amazing, food amazing ,ambiance amazing. 5 stars ++++ Addison is divine, 7 course meal with wine HEAVEN. Jesse the sommelier is wonderful. He knows his stuff and we love the hotel bar for muddled cocktails by Diego! You will not be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “THE GRAND DEL MAR IS GRAND INDEED!”
Reviews.Author: durigirl1
Reviews.Content: This was our first but not last visit to this elegant, luxury resort. From the moment we arrived it felt as if we had been transported to nirvana. The staff is not only courteous and well informed, but also very gracious. The entire property exudes class and graciousness. We had a winter package and for all of the amenities, the price was very fair for such a resort. We especially enjoyed having the courtesy car take us to restaurants in town at night. The concierge service was outstanding. I loved the underwater music in the relaxation pool! Kudos to all the staff and management! This resort is first class all the way. It is so worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: CCGrandma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times and each time is a wonderful experience. The lobby and common areas are so beautiful and well maintained we hate to leave the resort. The rooms are lovely and housekeeping is excellent. The staff is always there with a smile and never forgets your name and if you need anything at all they seem to have it.....we loved the Amaya restaurant and breakfast is superb. Just a short drive out of the resort is the town of Del Mar which we have found some wonderful shops and many good restaurants. The drive to LaJolla is beautiful as well as so many other along the coast. This is one of our favorite trips and stops in California.

Reviews.Title: “Why go to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: stephen10023
Reviews.Content: This is a phenomenal hotel. As good or better than any in Italy. Service is impecable. I dont know how it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best (if not the best) Resort that I have been too...”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night with my family (7y/o, 5 y/o, and 1 y/o) and another friend's (2 y/o, and 1y/o) checking out this resort (for a potential site for a possible work retreat). I want to preface by saying that I have stayed in a number of other top notch resorts (Ojai Valley Inn and Spa, Ritz Carlton, JW Marriott, La Quinta Reosrt and Spa, etc.) and none can compare. I will try to break it down for you all... Hotel and Checkin- This is a unique resort in that it is nestled in a gated community. I have never stayed here before and did not know anyone that has (much less heard of it). Upon driving up and valeting (pricey $30 per night), i was impressed to see a beautifully ornate lobby. Check in was a breeze. I requested a connecting room with the other family and that was quickly arranged. The receptionists actually greeted each of my children and offered them a toy from their treasure chest (never seen that before). He then walked us to the bellman and proceeded to lead us to the elevator. Very nice touch. Rooms: The rooms were on the 2nd floor. Beautifully decorated (made me feel as if I was staying in a palace). The bathroom was large and contained the closet. The bathroom was so large that we were able to put the pack n' play in their for my baby to sleep in. Each room had an espresso machine, as well as complimentary bottled water. Grounds: Immaculate. Very Very clean. Everything was in place. The pool area was very nice and even had soft white sand around the lounge chairs. They incorporated the golf course nicely and there were amazing views every where you look. Food/bar: We tried the snack shop (same kitchen as Amaya) once and Amaya twice (Dinner and Breakfast). The food was amazing everytime. Amaya for dinner had a great selection of food. I was not disappointed with anything that I tasted. They also have a huge selection of wine and scotch (my favorite). The lobby bar was great and I had my first taste of Absinthe there. The best thing I had was the complimentary cookie (and bottle of milk) that was provided during the turn-down service. Absolutely wonderful Golf: The course was in beautiful condition (even though it was at its prime condition). IT is pretty pricey but worth a shot if you are a golf fan. They included a fore caddie (my first experience with one) which made the experience wonderful. The practice facility was top notch (ProV-1 practice balls). Food/drink can be brought to you at anytime during your round. The course is private and closed to the public, thus the rounds are pretty fast pace and never crowded. Awesome golf experience. Spa: My wife is a self-proclaimed spa connoisseur and proclaims this to be one of the greatest spas that she has ever been too. Well ahead of the highly rated Ojai Valley Inn and Spa and on par with the Montage (Laguna Hill). She couldn't stop talking about the facility and service. Service: I have saved the best for last. The service is top notch. First class all around. I was expecting a snooty/snobby resort, but I could never have been more wrong. From the bellman to the waitress to the golf person to the cleaning lady, everyone was extremely polite and pleasant. Upon driving up, I initially laughed at the idea that this resort was "family friendly". I thought my family would be stared at and treated rudely, however, I could never have been more wrong. They bent over backwards to cater to my kids and family. They brought over a crib (with baby supplies) immediately. They found out it was my son's birthday and made him feel special the entire stay. They sent up a birthday dessert to the room. They gave him a gelato coupon (as well as one for each member of the family). He felt special the whole stay. There were also so many perks at this resort. I have also never been to a resort that offered 2 hrs of baby sitting (in the explorer club) while you are at your spa treatment. The wives and kids took advantage of the free shuttle (Mercedes Sprinter) to the local mall. Lastly, during our dinner at Amaya, everyone we encountered treated my family as if we were royalty. It wasn't the obvious things that caught my eye, but it was the attention to small details that amazed me. For example, my son was curious about our champagne, so the waiter went and put some Sprite in a decanter and pour it into a champagne glass for them (how awesome is that!). I can't say enough about their service... Sorry for the long detail, but as you can see, I thoroughly enjoyed our visit. I can honestly say that you will get what you pay for at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Like Italy in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: 1VintageRacer
Reviews.Content: Five star hotel, dinners and golf. Can't beat it for a February get away.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Property”
Reviews.Author: crownpacificgroup
Reviews.Content: A slice of haven tucked away with spacious rooms, wonderful amenities, great food, and exceptionally clean rooms and well kept grounds. The staff was friendly and very helpful. This is a hotel for a romantic weekend or fun for the entire family. I'll definitely recommend this is friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: Eichiban
Reviews.Content: A beautiful five-star resort. The room was beautiful with a unusual amount of attention to detail down to the NESPRESSO machine in the room. The resort has a wonderful old European feeling. Wonderful sitting and lounge areas - much like being at a large estate. The golf course is beautiful however it lacked the green coloring - waiting for spring colors!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Night Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: twoman04
Reviews.Content: My husband took me away for a night, escaping from our two boys and he picked the perfect place. I loved everything about The Grand Del Mar. The service is amazing, i love the decor, the bed was super comfy, the grounds are stunning....yes, we will me back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spa”
Reviews.Author: cindysk
Reviews.Content: We booked a day spa experience at this fabulous resort. From the minute you drive up it is hard to believe your are in the middle of a very suburban setting of San Diego. It is a very tranquil beautiful setting minutes away from the hustle and bustle of San Diego. Very posh and plush.European architechture. The Spa is beautifully appointed with marble and travertine throughout. Very nicely decorated changing area and dressing area with all you would need . Nice spa cuisine and teas. The lounge area is beautiful with a firelplace and wonderul luxurious daybeds and chaises. The therapists were top notch. I had a stone massage and it was heaven. The jacuzzi is inside and very spacious. Both wet and dry saunas available. After our treatments we had lunch at the restaurant Amaya which overlooks the pristine golf course. The food was delicious, as well as the service. It is very pricey but worth the luxury. We strolled around the property and it is immaculately kept. Was surprised to stumble on the hotels own church. A must for spa connoissuers. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Great property, kind of expensive but still worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: businessadvisor2
Reviews.Content: There is nothing quite like it I've ever seen: absolutely stunning. I was there for a meeting/conference, which was ideal. But I want to go back with my wife. This is truly an oasis of peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: HM1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just four nights during the summer... We could have stayed for ever! Cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. The rooms are excellent. Spacious, well furnished and extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are enormous, with walk in showers and huge baths. There are two pools, tennis courts and an amazing golf course, Tom Fazio designed. A divine spa as well. The food was excellent and decent room service too. The hotel has a special restaurant in the grounds called Addison, in addition to the ones in the main building. Addison is certainly worth a visit during your stay. They have a seven course tasting menu with wine pairing as well as a soft drink pairing - wonderful fruit juices specially mixed for each of the different courses. The food was divine. We stayed in for hours. The rooms were very reasonably priced. However, just one complaint, breakfasts were eye wateringly expensive. It was something ridiculous like $12 for a bread roll. I think one morning we were charged something absurd like $60 for a basket of bread, two coffees and two orange juices. In the event that a bed and breakfast deal is on offer, take it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property, Best-in-class Service”
Reviews.Author: jennylebeouf
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many hotels & resorts and didn't have any expectations for this stay, but was totally blown away by the service at this hotel. This ranks up there with best staff i have ever seen at a hotel property, and ranks in my top 3. The room was nice, but not very large. I was on the first floor and had patio access to a large shared lawn. Bathroom had bathtub, shower, and separate toilet. As i was there with a group we had several meals out on the front lawn, all of good quality. I also had an excellent Cobb Salad in the Amaya Restaurant on site, with some of the best lemonade i've ever tasted. We had one dinner at Addison, their signature restaurant, which was delicious and coupled with great local wines. I would highly recommend a meal there if staying at the hotel. Afterwards, go downstairs to Club M for some music and drinks. There's a great selection of on-site amenities including several pools, hiking trails, gym, horseriding, and a fun golf course. The golf course should get a better selection of left-handed rental clubs, as i was left with a mediocre set, with regular flex shafts and missing a putter (later brought to me on hole 5). What stood out the most during this stay was the level of service. Staff are trained very well and very respectful and assist in all possible ways. I haven't seen this level of service at any hotel in the world i've stayed at in the past 10 years. The only minor issues i had were: - In my opinion, bathroom amenities do not meet the level of this hotel. - Some issues with my TV. - Lengthy walk from self-park lot.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Luxurious Retreat”
Reviews.Author: netgrl22
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of visiting this hotel with my husband for a business function. The grounds were beautiful and the service was wonderful throughout our stay. Our room was a standard room and was a great size with a huge bathroom with two sinks! Everything was very comfortable and clean. My only small complaint on the room is that we had a ground floor room and the patio door did not lock as well as it should have. That said it was very safe at the resort so we were not too concerned. I ate a number of meals at the hotel catered for my group which were all good but not great. I also did a massage at the spa. While the spa facility was fabulous I found the treatment to be very average for the price. This hotel is definitely outside of my usual budget but I hope that I have a chance to come back and relax in luxury again someday!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic way to end our holiday”
Reviews.Author: ET59
Reviews.Content: After spending 10 days in theme parks and aquaria it was with great relief to roll into the Grand Del Mar. The place is absolutely gorgeous and the staff take 5 star service to new levels. From the front desk giving our kids a free gift from their treasure chest to the room service staff the care was attentive , professional but not at all snobby. The concierge and Golf club staff really impressed me by getting me onto the course ready to play inunder 10mins ( including finding me pants, and the whole kit ) The pools were great and warm even in the evening, on the first night we went we had 4 pools all to our selves ! Location is great for seeing San Diego , prob 30mins to anything yet peaceful and serene, almost the opposite to Disney. We had room service every night ( yes a bit of luxury but heck why not? and our kids just loved having dinner tucked in bed!) but I must say I havent seen such quality in a room service menu ( it was delicious) for a long time and it was much better value than you would expect. Room was more spacious than most , huge bath and complimentary water and wi-fi. Self parking worked a treat and with a $100 resort credit , I thought it was really good value against what Ive seen in the world at this level. Yes it does feel a bit "clubby or exclusive" but thats probably more to do with some of the guests who like to flaunt their wealth than the hotel itself. I am a convert and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: chewpei
Reviews.Content: I could have sworn I reviewed this property soon after staying here, but that review never appeared - ?? When I saw it was ranked #2 in US resorts (I believe that was the category) I felt I needed to weigh in. While this resort is very nice, it wouldn't be my top pick in the whole country. The room is beautifully furnished, but not that big. I don't know that I'd want to stay there for longer than a few days before I'd feel like we were on top of each other. The bathroom was certainly the best part of the room -- spacious and well appointed. But the opening into the room made no sense to me. Our "shutters" closing this opening kept popping open and we had to have housekeeping come and fix them closed. As other reviewers have noted, some of the rooms have no usable balcony, which was unfortunately the case with our room. Why would you not have a space in some of the rooms where you could sit and enjoy the lovely scenic grounds? Yes, the service is outstanding and they truly want to help you however they can. All staff was friendly, saying hello in the halls. About the halls -- our room was way at the end of the building so we spent a long time walking in freezing halls. When the temperature is only the low 70's I couldn't understand why they over air conditioned the halls. Thankfully we were here with a business group and someone else was picking up the tab. I inquired about additional nights and found it is very expensive. It is a very nice resort, but I didn't feel it was worth the price. The main reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that we were consistently disappointed by the food. We had a few dinners and cocktail parties, and there were flaws with each meal. Perhaps I am being picky, but if it's a top resort the food should be great too. We had better meals in the town of Del Mar. The activities they offered were a wonderful addition to our stay -- I took a canyon hike and had friends who took fitness classes. As nice as it was, I have no desire to go back, which is why I don't understand it's top rating in the country!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Luxury Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob98fatboy
Reviews.Content: Went for 30th Anniversary and couldn't be nicer. Everyone was friendly and place was spectacular. Hiking trails were nice and golf course views were amazing. Take advantage of the driving service into town and beach. Free and you don't have to worry about driving.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first time, it was great. The unfortunate part was having to leave!!! They had delivered to our room, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The accommodations were immaculate - first class. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the slippers, toilet, shower, furniture, etc. Not one negative thing about this place, though the cost per night could be less. It is awesome, but a tad overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “terrific overall experience”
Reviews.Author: jlfor
Reviews.Content: Attended a business conference at this resort last week and found it exceptional. Top shelf service from beginning to end. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and everything I expected. Food and lounge service was very good. One dinner at Amaya and I had no idea that such a high-end restaurant was on property. The golf course is quite challenging (lot of elevation changes) and my one complaint was poor forecaddy service. I jogged the trails in the hills behind the resort and loved the back-to-nature aspect just steps away from the pool and tennis center. An interesting service element - staff steps to the side of the hallway as you pass and always says hello. Unique. Truly one of the nicer places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Chasity N
Reviews.Content: My family ( 13 y/o and 10 y/o, husband) stayed for 2 days on Jan 1-3rd. It is an incredible place and all of the excellent comments are spot on! It's too bad that nowadays you have to pay alot to get attentine, friendly service and a clean beautiful room, but if you can splurge- DO IT! It was a beautiful weekend, with great weather, and fortunately we arrived just as the holiday crowd was leaving. We lounged by the pool, went horse back riding and just had a relaxing couple of days. My kids were sad to leave, and are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Oozes Conservative San Diego-ness. Great Service, Though”
Reviews.Author: drustrange
Reviews.Content: I stay in San Diego / Carlsbad are a couple of times a year, and I've had some disappointing experiences in the hotels; my guess is that with the neve-rending supply of tourists the hotels have a steady stream of customers no matter how bad they are. Over the years this has led me up the food chain of hotels in the area, culminating this past Thanksgiving with a 5-day stay at the Grand Del Mar. Location: Far from the city proper and the beach. Think of it as a retreat. First impression upon driving up: I know someone's going to tell you it's chic, but the Grand Del Mar looks like the architectural love child of Hearst Castle and a Rapallo waterfront hotel. Car valet: I don't grok the "cars impart status" meme. I drive a Subaru Forester - very practical. After driving down I-5 from San Fran, my car looked like a dirty little troll next to all the Escalades, Mercedes, Audis, and BMWs in front of the Del Mar. Whatever. Front desk: Impeccable service at check-in. We asked for accommodations near the adult pool. Because I'd asked for a suite and one wasn't available, they gave us a room with an unusually large balcony. Thank you, front desk man. A+ Room: The room was extremely clean and about 1.5x the size of a typical hotel room, with fresh furnishings and upholstery. The bed was too soft for my taste but other people will probably like it. The bathroom was modern and spacious as well - lots of stone and glass and mirrors but didn't tip over into the Vegas Zone. Shampoos and lotions were of good quality. Overall, the room met expectations given the price. Room service: Completely awesome. Everything we ordered was always correct, on time, warm, well-prepared, and well-presented. Pool: I often choose hotels because I want to do lap swimming. The Del Mar's adult pool (they call it the Quiet Pool) was definitely usable for this purpose. It's longer than 25 meters, super clean, and non-crowded in November (I was often the only one in the pool). However, it's way too warm for exercise. Also, there was new age music playing *underwater* at one end of the pool, which was a little weird till I figured out that I wasn't experiencing auditory hallucinations. After my swim an attendant unobtrusively brought me a glass of ice water, which was a first for me and a very nice touch. He also brought a menu, and if the day had been warmer I'd have ordered lunch and some sort of fruity cocktail - the pool area just puts you in that sort of mood. Overall, I'd give the Quiet Pool and its surroundings an A for design and service, B- for lap swimming. Grounds: Cutesy, utterly non-creative landscape-design. Very well-manicured. Lots of courtyards, fountains, gazebos, tiny privet hedges, rose trees, citrus in amphorae, and other cliche'd frou-frou, but it's restful to the eye. There's a croquet lawn with a St. Francis statue, and we often saw people playing, which was anachronistically delightful. I very much enjoyed watching the Brits turning croquet into an extreme sport... don't ask. B- for the grounds because they was sort of fun to stroll through. Once. Addison restaurant: We had Thanksgiving dinner at Addison. The food was very good but no way was it worth $600 for two people. Service was good but a little slow - I'd give them a pass on this because it was Thanksgiving, but the restaurant was over half empty. I checked the prices on the wines we were offered on my phone: they were selling $18 bottles of wine for $80+. Not unusual, I guess, but I wouldn't eat here again. Amaya restaurant: We had brunch and lunch on Amaya's heated patio several times - everything was delicious and the service was great. They even brought a water bowl for our dog, and let him sit under the table while we ate. Top notch casual dining! A+! Golf course: Dunno. The grass was green and rolling and there were holes here and there for balls to roll in and dudes dressed all preppy and plaid-y driving little clown cars around. Some people like this sort of thing. Hiking and horseback riding: Ok, this is not a hiking destination but we were traveling with our dog, and he's large and needs exercise. So I took him out on the Del Mar's horseback riding trails. I appreciated the convenience of having a trail on-site. The horseback riding is for the kiddies: just a couple extremely agreeable horses, and some short trails 'round the golf course. Kids under 12 will like it fine. Hiking D-, dog-walking A, horses B+. Dog friendly: Their website says they're dog-friendly, and before booking my reservation I called to confirm - we were showing up on Thanksgiving day and I didn't want to have any problems. The agent assured me that our dog would be welcome. And sure enough, when we checked in, nobody raised an eyebrow when we walked in with our 80-lb Rottie mix. HOWEVER. In our room, the binder of hotel services said that they only welcome dogs under 25 lbs. Nobody questioned us or gave us a hard time in the 5 days we were there, but we were *aware* that he wasn't really supposed to be there. It cast a bit of a pall on our whole stay. One big demerit to the Del Mar for not stating this on their website or when I called. Overall, the hotel was expensive but served up the value. The food at Amaya and from room service was very good. The room was nice and the pool was usable for lap swimming. The place is a tad clubby / smug with itself, but after 5 days I felt relaxed and as if I had been well cared for, so I might return anyway. I still feel bad about the dog, though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a great property !!! You will not be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Wetravelthere
Reviews.Content: Gang, please know that this is one of the best properties that I have visited in a long time. I can give our experience here an unadulterated "excellent" rating. It appears that "all" the rooms are well appointed with views of the beautiful courtyards or pool areas. Bathrooms have carrera marble with beautiful double vanity. Butlers pantry area is nice touch. If it feels that I am in love with this property, you would be correct. Staff is very friendly and professional, without being pretentious . It is about a 25 minute car drive from the San Diego airport to this hotel. The taxi fare is about $60 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Truly "One of the Best Places in the World to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: pascalphx
Reviews.Content: This property is nested in a secluded area of San Diego. As you pass the gated area, the attendant will check your name and the front desk will have all your documents ready by the time you arrive at the hotel entrance. You will be spoiled from the minute you check in. We arrived at the hotel on December 25 for 5 blissful days. We checked in and after a warm welcome extended by the staff we were given a small hot towel at the reception desk to freshen up. In the lobby hot cider and sweets were being served. We walked around the manicured Christmas grounds and admired the splendor of the hotel. Our room was on the first floor and faced the relaxation pool. The terrace in our room was the perfect place to relax in the afternoon while enjoying the sun. The room was more like a suite very spacious and impeccable in every detail. The amenities included a Nespresso coffee machine and a fully stocked refrigerator and bar. In the evening, the maid turned down our bed and left a nice touch of rose petals and chocolates next to our bed and the oversized tub in the bathroom. The bell man will offer to shine your shoes at night and have them ready for the next day. The room was cleaned promptly every day and attention was given to details to make sure it remained impeccably clean. Concierge services were excellent and they would go out of their way to help make sure our stay had all the options we wanted. The large foyer has 2 fireplaces and we enjoyed having drinks and listening to live music in the evening. We visited the main dining room every day for breakfast and sat outside. The waiter staff was very attentive to details and made sure our meals arrived promptly and warm. Did I mention that there is a gorgeous golf course? Horseback riding and tennis are also available. And let’s not forget a great spa to be fully pampered. Alas, we had to leave. I cannot say enough about this 5 Star Resort. It was a delight to be there and we will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel. I don't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: jane_eyles
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great. The rooms are enormous, beds the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the staff unbelievable. We couldn't fault it in any way. The patio rooms overlooking the spa pool are brilliant as it is like having an enormous private pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate 5-Star in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: clutchbomb
Reviews.Content: First of all, how could anyone NOT give this property a 5-star rating???? The resort is absolutely impeccable and stunning. You really could be anywhere in the world. I have lived throughout Europe and this property definitely brings me back to that classic Tuscan villa era- but with modern amenities. My favorites: The grounds- flawless, perfectly manicured and breathtaking; rooms- large, spacious, gorgeous views; Addison (restaurant)- amazing food and wine (they have great custom-made virgin cocktails for non-drinkers as well); absolutely love the Chapel- a must-see for any brides to be. I recommend this property to everyone- there is a reason why The Grand Del Mar is #1. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.....”
Reviews.Author: UAE455
Reviews.Content: Will summarize the experience in 1 sentence, if you can afford it go for it and you will have an experience unmatched by any other hotel. Fabulous/Exceptional/Gorgeous etc........ Also i would like to thank all the staff there whom made our stay wonderful.especially Thayer,Adam,Alaa and some that i forgot there names ,oh also the valet service.....Keep up the good work Stayed there from 23rd-27th of Dec 2011 , Saeed Alfahim

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Jannazg
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel, the rooms are large and well appointed, and the service is unmatched. If you can afford it, it's really a marvelous place, but not for those who are concerned about keeping a budget while on a vacation. It is not close to the beach, but secluded in a green and garden like environment and feels very private. I had room service many times and it was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Unique Hotel on Great Property-- Huge Rooms, Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: gsmyles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights with 2 small children. It is a sumptuous resort with multiple pools, great views, secret gardens, meandering paths, and extremely luxuriou appointments. The rooms were huge and it felt like staying in a masculine palace. Located on a golf course, many dining options, and great location if you have a car. Is it cheap-- no way....but will you have a quality stay? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “A admitted "hotel snob" and this is the Most luxurious hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: shelliesv
Reviews.Content: When we travel, we enjoy staying at nicer properties and often find many things to complain about despite extensive research before booking our travel; however, THIS was the first time I can remember that everything was just perfect and this is the resort of our dreams! Nicer than luxury resorts we've stayed at in Hawaii, Aruba, the Caribbean, and Mexico! From the moment you arrive you are made to feel like royalty! The staff anticipates your every need before you even realized you needed something! The service is unparalleled! I wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return to San Diego! The rooms were very generously sized and very luxurious. Chocolates on your pillow at night, fresh rose petals, cozy robes, bottled water by your bedside, an ice bucket full and waiting for you to return to your room at night, Whirlpool tub, TV in bathroom, gorgeous property, and service beyond compare! Everything was done right here! My husband went for a swim at the outdoor heated pool (he was the only one there in November) and before he got out, they had a glass of ice water and a towel waiting for him! I had mentioned when I booked the room that we were celebrating my 40th birthday and the night before we left, we returned to our room that night to find a personalized letter from the hotel, a bottle of champagne on ice with 2 glasses and a special dessert celebrating my birthday! It was such a wonderul gesture! LOVED, LOVED, LOVED every minute of this stay! Also had a facial at the space and hairstyling, again services were unsurpassed. The spa is one of the most luxurious in the world. Very pricey, but definitely worth the experience! Will return again and again! Can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Everything”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveler47
Reviews.Content: Came here for a company retreat and was pampered beyond belief. From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave you are amazed by the staff service and the absolute beauty of this resort. The hotel is not actually in Del Mar but inland a little so no ocean view but the vistas are incredible and you are out of the fog and beach dampness so it was nice. I thought I was in in Tuscany. The food at the company dinner was fabulous, the wine perfect. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms very luxurious oh and they even have espresso makers in the rooms! Definate bonus. Lovely hotel can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan R
Reviews.Content: From the minute you arrive, in this fabulous, spacious, and super luxury hotel, your every need is met. My five night stay in october 2008 , exceeded my expectations, from amazingly clean and oversized rooms, to an incredible spa. The concierge team were so helpful and the management were not only efficent but extremely friendly and professional. If i hadn't of searched the internet for this hotel, i'd have never discovered what a crown in san diego's jewel this is....... This is a CLASS ESTABLISHMENT, and i'd never comprehend staying anywhere else in San diego!

Reviews.Title: “Grand indeed!”
Reviews.Author: geezerhippie
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar is located in some foothills east of Del Mar, in a very upscale "toney" neighborhood. The grounds are immense and perfectly landscaped. Even the golf course has waterfalls, a stream, and colorful flowers everywhere. I love the fact that you can "self park" your car FOR NO CHARGE! What a wonderful option for those of us who are quite capable of walking to our car, and do not like paying $20.00-$35.00(Four Seasons, Vail)a day to park our car. Every hotel should have this option available, and not just tell visitors they have no choice. Hurrah for the Grand del Mar on this matter. The lobby has various designs of marble flooring, classical furniture and wallhangings, and fresh flowers.The intercom system has nice Spanish music playing, even in the elevators! Right off of the lobby is a formal living area, library, and cocktail lounge. Stunning! Check-in went smoothly, and I "held my breath" that our room would be in a good location. When we walked in we were overwhelmed with the grandeur and opulence of the room. We have stayed in several Ritz Carlton's, some incredible hotels on 4 Hawaiian islands, as well as gorgeous properties in Mexico, and this one was the nicest by far. We lucked out for sure with a perfect location. Alot of grand hotels have fabulous grounds and commom areas, but the rooms are just regular- not this hotel! The bathroom had a large marble tub, large shower, closeted toilet, two sinks with a television in between the mirrors, a chandalier, and pass-through space that can be opened/closed as desired, opening the bath area to the bedroom. Marble, marble everywhere- "Wow"! The closet is substantial, has a safe, and bath robes. There was a mini-bar in the room hallway, but no microwave. The room was large, and the bed was extremely comfortable. My very favorite part was opening the sliding glass doors to find a large balcony" looking out" onto a huge courtyard, with a view of some plush homes on the hillside nearby. It was as if we were actually on the French Riviera. Our room was on the 3rd floor, and we couldn't have been happier. Instead of putting a tag on the doorknob for privacy or service needed, you punch a button that lights up in the hallway next to the door. Green light-room needs cleaning/ Red light-privacy please. Brillant idea! Because we had eaten a late lunch before checking in, we decided to order room service for a change. It was tasty, delivered promptly on a cart with a white tablecloth and flowers, and just nice to enjoy our room that night. This was the only good food we had from the hotel. The next morning, after getting espressos from the hotel coffee bar, we decided to "take a tour".The property is so large, that it took us about 2 hours just to walk around ! We kept saying "Wow" over and over. The golf course is right next door, and there are some privately owned Villa style homes adjacent to the main building. If any of you are planning a very special wedding, I'd highly recommend the Grand del Mar!They have a quaint European style chapel right on the property, and many rooms to choose for a reception, not to mention the outside covered areas with fireplaces and firepits.. You will be "living like Royalty" ! There is an olympic size "adult's only" pool, which is next to the hotel spa. Servers bring out chair cushions, towels, and drinks/snacks.The family pool was in another area, and the children seemed to be having a great time. We stayed at the adult pool, then took a walk on the path that goes around the property-peaceful, quiet, and as if we were in Tuscany. The only disappointing part of this visit was the food in the restaurants. We ate lunch at the golf club, sitting outside to enjoy the cool," sunshiny" day. Our cocktails were fine, but the fish tacos were terrible, and I mean awful ! There were 4 small uncooked white shells, with a few morsels of grilled fish on each, topped by some tasteless white cabbage. No pico de gallo, no sour cream, no guacamole, no red cabbage or special sauce, It was bland and tasteless. We were very disappointed. That evening we ate at one of the hotel restaurants, and again were very disappointed in the food. It was nice sitting outside near a firepit, being able to gaze at the moon and stars, and smell the fresh air. However I could barely finish my dinner. To be honest, I don't even remember what I had, and my husband call tell you that I can verbally recite every superb meal I have ever had, even 20 years ago, in full detail. Both of us disappointed again. If we are in the area again we will definitely splurge (over $400.00 a night) for two nights and stay here again, but will go elsewhere for lunch and dinner. You may want to "check out" on the internet nearby places to eat that are good. The concierges were extremely friendly and efficient, but were hesitant to recommend nearby restaurants. Naturally the hotel wants visitors to stay there and eat at the hotel's restaurants.. Everything was expensive, and the food just wasn't worth the high price. We "saved up" a few years ago to stay at the Highlands Inn in Carmel, which was romantic and unique, and now we also have special memories of this" splurge stay" at the Grand del Mar. Special place! Go for the ambiance, luxury and serenity, not for a gourmet food experience, and you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: TRDesk
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this hotel before my husband had a meeting there. I was so shocked at how unbelievably fabulous it is. The service is amazing. The decor is beyond belief. They didn't miss a trick. Every detail is taken care of, down to the tassle on the key to the mini bar. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Aga7
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was absolutely amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Property!”
Reviews.Author: KarenR14
Reviews.Content: The grounds are lovely and the rooms so elegant that you could happily spend a rainy day inside. The only flaw that we found was not offering Big Ten football on the large TV's at the outside bar or golf course lounge, they did not subscribe to that network. Service is number one at the Grand Del Mar, the front of the house is most pleased to meet your requests with a smile and housekeeping is one of the best I have seen. Each day my tangled phone and computer electronic cords are neatly tied with a ribbon! The food is wonderful; do not miss their lobster bisque. We all have to decide how to spend our travel dollars, here is one resort that is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: nmc525
Reviews.Content: The service at Grand Del Mar is impeccable - you will not find better. The grounds are beautiful, the food is great and the golf course is nice (the caddies will impress you with their knowledge of the local vegetation). The only downside that I can think of is that the hotel is about 15 minutes to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: uxandcoffee
Reviews.Content: Our experience was lovely from the beginning to the end of our 4 night stay. We have a 2 and a half year old toddler, and so it was important for us to stay at a place that was both fun and relaxing. The grounds and the rooms are lavishly decorated, but not over the top... Our room was extremely comfortable with a wonderful bathroom and a view onto the courtyard. We ate salted caramel gelato every afternoon from their café. This café also made quality pour-over coffee… excellent for the (very) early morning caffeine fix. This is really necessary when you have a toddler. They used Peerless Coffee, and I am going to look up the site to buy some more after writing this review. The fitness center was great. It could be better lit (I “get it” in terms of spa-ambience). They had lots of room and equipment. We’ve stayed at The Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons, Club Meds, Exclusive Resorts… I have to say that this is, by far, the best hotel we’ve stayed at in the US... Outside the US, Exclusive Resorts -Costa Rica still beats it, but I think that’s because of the other amenities and amazing food we had in Costa Rica (see below). A few things to work on: 1.The Amaya restaurant is okay at best. A little too bland and the portions too big when they’re trying so hard. I ate the crab cakes benedict and it was… meh. That said, the staff was amazing with our son. They were so incredibly nice to him. I felt that they instinctively knew where the power really was in the family! The kids menu was simple and wonderful, and therefore, actually better than the adult menu. I think that Amaya would do well to focus on excellent.simple.organic.food. I wouldn’t care if the prices stayed the same. 2.The staff at Club M could be a little more courteous. They seemed to be disconnected with the other eating establishments on the grounds in terms of quality of service. (A very hilarious side-note about the perception of Club M by my local friends from La Jolla… They referred to Club M as the perfect pouncing territory for “Cougars” and golf caddies. So funny.) 3.We did valet every day/night. Complete ignorance on our part, but they had a garage conveniently attached to the hotel. We didn’t find this out until our very last night. It was truly a “duh” moment. FYI: $25 per night. 4.The place is HUGE. It took me 2 days to finally understand how to get back to my room. I think it would be a great investment to work on better signage and the map provided to guests. Every hallway looked the exact same (gorgeous framed tile and oil paintings of sheep), it was a little freaky at first… but then I figured out the maze…

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Love_Dana_Point
Reviews.Content: This resort is fantastic from the moment you step onto the property you know you are somewhere special. The rooms are gorgeous every detail was thought of from the turn down service to the perfect crown modeling. The service and staff are so friendly and helpful, can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property...feels long established even open only 2 months”
Reviews.Author: Roselle N
Reviews.Content: I had a recent business trip to the Grand Del Mar and found this new property to be a gem. It opened sometime in October 2007, yet it feels like it has been there forever. The attention to detail throughout the hotel is great. The rooms are top notch. I had a regular ol' king-size room and it was bigger than my first apartment. Huge tub, nice shower, wet bar, comfortable bed. And for once...a hotel had firm pillows in the room. Too often, other hotels seem to pick up their floppy pillows from second hand stores. The pillows at most other joints flatten out so much that it's like sleeping with a washcloth for a pillow. The food was very good. We ate one meal up at Addisons (?) and that meal was fantastic. The second dinner we had (in the chapel like room) was very good but didn't equal the other place. The staff is all very friendly and helpful. The cleaning crews did a great job each day. The one negative...there always has to be one right?...this hotel is located in California. That means that you cannot smoke cigars in their great lobby lounge or in the library room...both places begging to be enjoyed with some heaters. Stayed November 2007, traveled on business

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: redmanfloridapvb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel.From the bellman to room service the staff is outstanding.The grounds are a delight to walk around,You can't go wrong at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaBluebird
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to soak up the service and the ambiance. This is an excellent choice for a special celebration. Although not far from La Jolla and downtown San Diego, you never have to leave this magnificent resort in the hills to feel relaxed, pampered and entertained. Outdoor peaceful pools, hot tubs, lovely golf course, tennis, horseback riding, hiking trails, picturesque gardens, indoor spa, exercise classes, restaurants, evening musical entertainment -- all right there for your pleasure at the Grand Del Mar. Although there is a family pool and children's activities, this is most definitely an adult resort -- catering to an adult sense of aesthetics and need for tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “THE FINEST RESORT EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelerForSure
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar was one of the nicest resorts I have ever stayed at. Located in a beautiful area in the hills of Del Mar the setting is absolutely stunning. The property is is lovely, the buildings well detailed and overall just impeccable. When you check in the staff is friendly and professional. At check in they offer you a scented towel to prepare you for your delightful stay. The rooms are well appointed and beautifully sized with nice furnishings and a superb bathroom. Beautiful bath accessories, robes, room safe and lovely touches throughout. The ONLY item I thought was deficient was the shower was not very good at all, low water pressure. Funny how a hotel with such exceptional attention to detail would overlook one of the most important functions of the day, a good shower! Turn down service was lovely with rose petals in the bathroom and chocolates on the pillow that were always delicious! The staff is fantastic, they can’t do enough for you and very friendly yet professional. I tried the spa, excellent! Great massage, wonderful spa area, steam, sauna and whirlpool and wonderful amenities. Excellent gym with the best equipment. The food on property was also excellent. I can’t say enough good things about the Grand Del Mar and will definitely recommend it to everyone I know as well as come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation and the staff was the biggest treat”
Reviews.Author: erowe11
Reviews.Content: Oct 2011 spent a week with family at the Grand Del Mar. Gorgeous rooms, fantastic food (and no nickel-and-diming the small things -- Nespresso machine in room and free Wi-Fi) but it really was the staff that set the resort apart. Effortless grace and kindness from every single person. Not unctuous, just lovely. We really could not have had a more fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel, amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLawyer1
Reviews.Content: from the moment you are greeted by name at the lobby to the last second you drive out the grand drive, you will be pampered in a veritable lap of luxury. This hotel has few peers (the Ritz Carlton Naples may be one). This is a hotel that spared no expense in any public spaces, whose guest rooms are simply gorgeous, and whose staff are as attentive and friendly as any I have ever seen. My wife and I spent four days there, and were sad to depart from the exquisite pools, the stunning grounds and golf course, and fine food and friends we made there. Simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent, great service, a splurge but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Martha G
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 kids ages 7 and 10) stayed in the Grand Del Mar for 2 nights in August 2011 after spending a week in a rental house in La Jolla (couldn't get home because of Hurricane Irene). It was wonderful. The service throughout the hotel was top tier: at the pools, at the restaurants, housekeeping -- and the food was excellent. They were always attentive to our needs and accommodating to special requests. The décor is a little over the top for my tastes (an overly stylized version of an Italian villa), but it was quiet and serene and the grounds are gorgeous. We never left the hotel because we wanted to maximize our time there and we enjoyed every second of it. When planning our trip we had considered staying at the Del Mar for the whole week but opted for a rental house because it was much less expensive, but I wouldn't have wanted to pay those prices just to lay my head down at night. If you're going to be out and about exploring the area, a place like this may not be worth it. It's a luxurious escape from the world for as long as you can afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ajhawk_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Grand Del Mar. It may have ruined us for other hotels. Our room was beautiful, the service was top notch and the food was excellent. We spent our days at the Relaxation Pool (a.k.a. the grown-up pool), which was the perfect temperature regardless of the weather. The fitness room is the best I've seen at a hotel, and they have staff walking through to bring you water or help you with the equipment. We didn't see many families with young children, which for us was a plus. The only downside was the price. It was very expensive. A margarita at the pool, while delicious, is $15. We had a light dinner of shared appetizers and a couple of drinks in the lobby lounge for $120. If you're taking a relaxing, luxury vacation in San Diego, this is the place to stay, but be prepared to pay for it. We will definitely be back and would recommend it to friends who aren't penny pinchers.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: abitofsun
Reviews.Content: wonderful service throughout...room was spacious, clean, and well stocked. family pools were well kept and fun. mainly, the staff was helpful, courteous, and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jaspora83
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is the #1 place to stay in San Diego. Rating it "5" stars isn't even showing it justice. The Grand Del Mar is by far the most beautiful hotel in Southern California. Being at the resort gives an essence of another world. The grounds are well kept beyond the standards of the majority of hotels. The peaceful environment and stunning landscape is breathtaking! I have yet to find a place that exceeds my stay at the Grand Del Mar. The hotel encompasses a golf course that is used by many celebrities. The staff is phenomenal, they treat you like royalty. This hotel will make you want to move to California, you feel like you are in a dream world. I will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “6 STAR...Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: t b
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from this splendid and most amazing hotel so of course, I had to write about it! My family of 5 enjoyed the weekend there(children 11,8, and 13months). The decor was impeccable! Our "standard" double queen was lavished with incredible views of the perfectly landscaped property, we were served frozen grapes at the pool and smoothie samples...The service was great! I was nervous with 3 young children...but there was plenty for them to do. The adventure club kept the older ones busy and the baby pool was perfect for our little one. I really can't say enough about this property! If you are willing to splurge, it is worth EVERY penny!!! Can't wait to return to the spa!!! (without the kiddos) :)

Reviews.Title: “RIDICULOUS MIX OF DECOR STYLES - AVERAGE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Marsha123
Reviews.Content: Billed as 'Italian Villa' - mix of more styles that imaginable, totally lacking in any real style. Looked as if many different interior designers could not decide as to which period to copy. Restaurant dark and gloomy and average terrace for breakfast, with slow service and not particularly special food. Bedrooms comfy, though too much furniture and mix of styles. Golf club food lovely with views of the course. Staff cheerless. The management should check out Four Seasons service with is magnificent in comparison. (Santa Barbara, Westlake, Beverly Hills all excellent hotels.) We were members of 'I prefer' and even though hotel belongs, none of the staff knew anything about it nor the benefits associated with the group. Upon check in, we took couple of rooms, but surly staff, most unwelcoming for this level of hotel in this price bracket. Many more wonderful hotels up and down the California coast and inland, not sure why this hotel has such rave reviews, felt decidedly average to us. Would not go back nor recommend. Very expensive for such a mediocre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surpisingly Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: JLM2009
Reviews.Content: It's not really located near anything, but when are merely driving up to the entrance, you realize it doesn't matter. I'm not sure how old the property is, but gives off a vibe that it is an institution that has been giving 5 star service to hotel clients forever. It is charming and yet grandiose all at the same time. Attention to detail is reflected from the staff (concierge, front desk, bellmen, wait staff, pool staff, etc) to the designs on the moulding on the ceiling of the room. They somehow manage to decorate boldly (gold, patterns, tassles) withOUT seeming gaudy or overdone. It's warm and welcoming. I tend to rate hotels based more on staff than amenities, so I will say that I received the BEST service at this hotel... at least as good as any hotel I've ever been in... and I have been in the Mandarin Hotel in Hong Kong, the Peninsula Hotel in Kowloon (Hong Kong), Intercontinentals, Four Seasons, etc. Every person we came into contact with were both courteous and respectful. When they happened to ask you if you needed something, and you did NOT need something, they neither push for you to ask them if you need anything nor do they make you feel like you're wasting their time by sitting in their area and not doing anything. (it's a subtle line that they all seemed to do very well) Our family of three went (me, wife and 18 month old son) and they included a wooden crib in the room. When I had made the reservation, I included our son's name, and the crib had bedding that was geared toward boys. They also included a small bag of bath materials for babies, including soap, wash clothes, and toys ... these were complimentary. a VERY nice touch! Complimentary bottles of water were included in the room. They have 4 pools.... 1 adults only (18 and over), 2 large family friendly pools, and 1 smaller pool that is only 1 foot deep -- great for kids / babies. This is GREAT for kids. And yet, you never ever feel like this is a pool for families with kids running around. They seem to treat everyone like an adult with admiration and respect -- even our 18 month old! Upon checkout, they gave our son a small beanie baby toy. another great touch! We stayed in a Prado suite overlooking the golf course... it seems as though originally they were two individual rooms, and they knocked out a doorway. Made one half into a King size bedroom, and the other into the living room. Both bathrooms remained. The entire hotel is spectacularly appointed. The shops are overpriced, and there is not much to do there... We went to Sea World the next day and it was only about a 15 minute drive. I recommend checking in early, using the pool or spa or whatever relaxation facilities you'd like to use... enjoy the grounds, enjoy the hotel. Then the next day you can go off and explore or enjoy the San Diego activities as much as you like. It's not in the middle of the hustle and bustle of San Diego, and it's not near the beach...but in my opinion, as long as you'll have this to come back to at the end of the activity filled day, you really can't go wrong. You won't mind driving back here at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Brideshead for SoCal!”
Reviews.Author: MadeItBackHome
Reviews.Content: This place is ridiculous. On many web sites they show you photos taken from strategic angles to accent the positive. At the GDM, no photo can do it justice. Everything gleams with solid elegance. The furniture is museum quality, the amenities are just THERE, in reach, just what you need when you need it. The people are so nice you kind of wait for the other shoe to drop, but it never does. Just a great place. We came in late September, which is a great choice. Their high season is August, and in September it's a little ghostly. There are more staff than guests, but you quickly get used to it being your own home. Another great thing about off-peak are the packages - suites normally running $700 go for $500 or less. There are two main restaurants: Amaya is "casual" but terrific, while Addison is over the top - inspired by the French Laundry with a 10-course degustation (6, 4 and 3 course options are available) and a wine list running fully 190 pages. I recommend stopping by the afternoon of your meal and borrowing a copy of the wine list - that's the only way you can spend the necessary time. They have bottles from $60 to $12,000 (1982 Petrus). A truly outstanding meal. It's really worth a trip to San Diego to spend a few nights here - especially if you're a golfer.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: GolingGal949
