Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Grand Del Mar earlier this month. The rooms are spacious and beautiful, the bathrooms are amazing but what really stands out is the service. They couldn't do enough for us! From the room service guy who asked if he could help us with any plans, the room service guy!, to the valets who were wonderful and gave me an ice cream for the ride home once they found out it was my birthday, it was all top notch. We would have loved a more casual spot for dinner but even apres golf on the patio, they seemed to take good care of us! (We probably should have changed clothes!) Golf was amazing too. For a special getaway, you won't be disappointed although you will be a little lighter in the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: WildcatDad
Reviews.Content: We shared a weekend at this hotel with out of town friends in the "off-season". I rank this resort in my top 3 in the world - equal to Mauna Lani Bay Resort and Inn at Spanish Bay. The scenery is better at the other two resorts because of their ocean-front setting, but this is an inland resort in the hills that is also just as beautiful. What sets this apart is the luxury oozing from everywhere. The rooms are the most comfortable and spacious I've ever seen. The giant bathrooms with large showers are separated from the sleeping area by shuttered windows. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with large pools and Jacuzzis.The bar area (we dined in the bar one night) is also 5 star. You are isolated here, with outside restaurants a 15 minute drive away. The golf course is tough, long and well-manicured. Forecaddies a must. If you want elegance, comfort and a palatial resort, this is your spot. The cost is high, but worth it, and much cheaper than Pebble and Spanish Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: celticgirlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early August. We were on a trip with no kids, and we enjoyed some meals at the hotel. Our room was near the adult pool and one day I managed to lay by the pool and read an entire book, which is unheard of for me, very relaxed! Had a nice massage and a great jacuzzi in the spa. My husband enjoyed taking a long hike around the huge grounds. I liked having cocktails in the library and main bar area, excellent service. We had an outstanding meal at Market one night. I will be back to this hotel and can't reccommend it high enough. It is pricey but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Manchester Presidential Suite was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Gerintell
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family (who frequents the hotel) in one of (if not the) best rooms in the hotel. The top floor presidential suite offered every amenity - including those nobody needs. With two spacious rooms with absolutely enormous bathrooms (three of them,) and every detail down to a science one can not help but feel pampered by their very presence in this suite. The restaurant close-by which the hotel drives you to in a private town car is also one of the best I have ever experienced. The wine and food were both superb, and one does not often see so many courses in America. I have eaten at some of the finest restaurants in the US and this one simply stood out in an entirely different class. Overall this stay was well over a month ago, and truly the images should speak greatly towards the true experience where I cannot, but suffice to say this was one of my most memorable stays in my long history of staying at different hotels. If you are looking to celebrate an occasion, or perhaps simply get away from the city, this is a wonderful place to do so. You will not regret it certainly if you make the most of your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINMOMMA2
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service - staff is very professional and caters to guests needs. Very personable. Facility grounds are beautiful. Rooms large and comfortable. Food is fantastic. Golf course is also outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Sets The Bar”
Reviews.Author: vlrosario
Reviews.Content: This hotel sets the bar for all hotels. Luxurious rooms, excellent service and the food at the hotel restsurant was delicious (something that is unusual for a hotel restaurant). This property is pricey but worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “They do it right!"”
Reviews.Author: Jen G
Reviews.Content: We are well traveled and this is one of our favorite places to stay. It was our 2nd stay with our girls (5 and 12). We were a bit lazy and ate most of our meals at the hotel. Pool food is qood quality and inexpensive for the kids ($6). Drinks are resort pricey, as expected. Ate at Amaya a few nights and food did not meet our expectations. Service at front desk and car valet was spectacular. Their crew was friendly and interacted well with the kids. No resort fee, however, we were surprised by a daily, valet parking fee of $25. They didn't charge this 2 years ago and it wasn't advertised on the site or on our reservations. Not a big deal, but it should be clear to guests. Rooms are "over the top" and hotel is very clean. Grounds are meticulous with spectacular views. My husband played golf and absolutely loved it. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Morty_momma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights - we were extremely pleased with every aspect of the experience. It was an expensive stay, but you get what you pay for. We also had our dog, and the grounds are very green and lush and it was a perfect place to let him roam outside. We took a hike right from the hotel with our dog and it was a nice way to spend an afternoon (the concierge will give you a map of the nearby hikes). We were impressed by the staff's attention to detail and we truly felt taken care of. The adults only pool is a nice place to relax and have lunch or a cocktail; the jacuzzi is very large and not crowded. I did not leave the hotel for the full 48 hours and was satisfied spending all of my time in San Diego at this hotel. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This is like a " Hole in One " experience”
Reviews.Author: gcr032
Reviews.Content: Grand Del Mar is seculed and yet close to everything .We spent the morning playing golf and challenging the ponies in the afternoon . The staff is the most qualified and sensitive to your needs that I have experienced in sometime .The Golf course is in top -notch shape and will press your handicap in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: FallbrookTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference and would love to return to vacation. Service is attentive, rooms are large and comfortable. Feels like a luxurious historic hacienda. Very close to San Diego activities but feels secluded.The spa was very nice. Husband enjoyed the golf course. Only negative is that it is in the flight path to the navel air station and the flyovers can be a little loud. See comments about room selection.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special”
Reviews.Author: princessadelle
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, I came here for work and never wanted to leave. I was stuck in SD due to Hurricane Irene, and the staff went above and beyond to help make my stay as comfortable as possible. The food is fantastic, the service is amazing and the spa was very relaxing. My only negative experience was the snotty receptionists at the Salon Desk. which was later rectified by the salon mgr. I will definetly be back, and I cannot wait to hold my meeting here in November.

Reviews.Title: “Grand It Is!”
Reviews.Author: johnpaul17
Reviews.Content: The Grand is indeed that. Someone has put mega money into this place. The hotel is truly elegant, and the staff made us feel extremely important. Everyone is friendly and extremely helpful. The facility is clean to a fault, and the restaurants are first rate. Pros: Elegant resort-type hotel with all the trimmings-golf, spa, fitness center, great restaurants, helpful staff who are eager to please. Cons: Location in Northern San Diego, near Del Mar, with little to do within 20 minutes of the hotel- but the race track, if open, is a blast. The only other comparable hotel in Southern CA that I have been to is Pelican Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Came for a Wedding and never left the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susie20817
Reviews.Content: In a word -- this place is gorgeous. The rooms are luxurious. The spa is splendid and the peace and quiet was soothing. We'd been to San Diego before, so literally didn't leave the grounds an entire weekend. We watched the florist prepare for the wedding from our balcony and thought the banquet facilities were superb. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Say Enough About This Place!! We Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegas50
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Grand Del Mar in as many years. We stayed at the resort for one week. Because we book through American Express, we had a $65 breakfast credit each day, which we used to order room service. The food was very good. All of the service people are top-notch. Every single one was very courteous and "went the extra mile". The one thing I chuckled about was the fact that almost every employee uses the word "Absolutely" and "Perfect". They do make you feel special there. We were celebrating our anniversary and within an hour of our arrival, champagne and a fancy little dessert were delivered to our room. Laura, the girl that delivered it, remembered me from our visit last year. Besides room service, we dined at Amaya, which was also very delicious. We requested Brian for our server. He waited on us last year and he was really a delight. My husband likes to "talk sports" and Brian was up to the task. Brian remembered us and recalled that we were from Las Vegas and even recalled a health issue that my husband experienced last year. The lobster bisque and butter lettuce salad was excellent, as well as their pretzel bread. Two nights we had casual fare in the Lobby Bar. Kellie was our server and was very efficient. She moves around the bar like a whirling dervish. We had the margharita pizza, sliders and chicken quesadillas. They will permit you to order from the Amaya menu and will serve you in the bar, in case you don't feel like dressing up a little for Amaya. Although, I have to say, that a lot of people were dressed very casual at Amaya. We did purchase some snacks and coffee drinks at Cent Anni, their coffee shop. I had the best iced vanilla chai latte. I had never had one before and it was great. The only thing we were not impressed with was their Concierge personnel. They did not seem on par with the level of service that we received from everyone else. Also, they gave us some misinformation regarding valet parking at a downtown restaurant. We enjoyed walking around the grounds. There is a loop around the perimeter that is .7 miles. We walked that numerous times. Each of us had a treatment at the spa. My husband enjoyed a massage and I had an exfoliation/massage treatment. I wasn't that thrilled with mine, but that was because I have sensitive skin and should not have picked that particular treatment. Their spa is very elegant and relaxing. We can't wait to return next year for our anniversary in August.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: 02Hoosier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a "babymoon" to The Grand Del Mar. We had read all of the great reviews on tripadvisor and agree with most of them. This was one of the nicest properties I've ever stayed at with a very accommodating staff. The front desk attendant was very courteous when we arrived and held our bags while our room was prepared. The only thing I would have liked was a more detailed explanation of everything that is at your disposal at the resort. We figured it out, but there is a lot going on that you can choose from. While we were there we spent most of our time at the pool, fitness center and spa. There is an adult pool as well as a family pool, both are great. The fitness center is top-notch and my wife and I were able to get a great workout in each day. Watch out for the snakes on the trail though if you decide to head out for a run....nice little surprise although I wasn't shocked. I expected to come away with one thing that just stood out to me above all else, but I didn't. Regardless, this was a fantastic property with a very friendly staff and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL GROUNDS AND ROOMS BUT........”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: The RELAXATION POOL AND JACUZZI was not that!!!!!!!!!!!!(had descending steps though)......we were in the jacuzzi no one was there but us talking and a pool attendant told us we were TOO LOUD........he said(people were sleeping).....was this the WHISPERING MUTE POOL?.....very annoying,too snooty never went there again........the other pool's and jacuzzi's had a major problem too...NO DESCENDING STEPS.........(MAJOR PROBLEM) .......very difficult to get in and out.....bruised OUR knees and toes........we ended up going to the beautiful Del Mar Beach instead( picked up by the hotel and brought back) set up with chairs, water and an umbrella......:-).......also needed was a more casual restaurant and BEWARE when booking a room........some have BALCONIES you can sit out on and others have STANDING ones where you can't sit on ...... SAME PRICE(not mentioned on website)(we changed our room since we wanted a sitting balcony room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: mrduffy
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, friendly hotel. Large, clean, nicely decorated rooms. The golfing is first rate. The restaurant (Addison) is fabulous, if you're into nouvelle cuisine. Good work out facility too.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Think of A Nicer Place”
Reviews.Author: jewelArizona
Reviews.Content: The thing I like the most is EVERYTHING. From the time you arrive you are treated like royalty. They remember your name and use it every time they see you. The pool, golf course, restaurants are the best you will go to. The hotel has a car service that will take you to the beach and includes beach chairs, water bottles and towels. You get dropped off right at the beach and picked up anytime you tell them. It was Perfect. The location was not a problem, 20 minutes to downtown San Diego if you need to leave the hotel at all. We ate at the restaurant Amaya, and danced at their nightclub several times. Club M was super fun with a DJ who played some awesome music that included videos on the big screen of the artist. The rooms have every thing you will need and if by chance you are missing something, just call the front desk, they will have it for you a.s.a.p. We met people at the pool from all different states and countries which made our trip that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagant”
Reviews.Author: Engshosho
Reviews.Content: So romantic it was a perfect choice for my honeymoon.every thing was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding with reservations”
Reviews.Author: Jesusislife
Reviews.Content: Family vacation situation. The decor, attention to detail - both indoor and out is breathtaking. Absolutely 5*. Everything is quality. Wide hallways and large guest rooms with extremely comfortable beds. Also, real solid hardwood doors, coffee tables polished to a mirror shine, lawn and patio chairs very comfortable, marble flooring, solid brass faucets and sinks, in-room expresso makers and even covers for AC vents! Employees seem genuine. Smiles everywhere. Greeting you by name of course. Had an issue with tennis court reservations. Scheduled day before our arrival for 11am. After showing up with my family - all 5 of us - another family was there saying they had reserved also. Called concierge who apologized sincerely but still didn't have reasonable explanation for screwup. Overall concierge service was average. I asked concierge several questions about activities around San Diego and she kept handing me brochures instead of more individualized attention. Ate at Anaya restaurant with the kids. Had their sea bass and glass of Syrah both were excellent. Staff bends over backwards to please. Sat at the library around 9:30pm and over half hour period was asked if I needed something - twice. Best of all theres free wifi throughout resort and many of their activities are also free to guests. Overall I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Posh”
Reviews.Author: njfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: This place is perhaps the finest resort at which we've stayed. Everything about this place lives up to it's "Grand" reputation. First of all, the place is tucked away in a canyon about 5 miles from the beach and about 15 miles north of downtown - perfect location, if you ask me. The Grand is sprawling with immaculate grounds and pristine pools. The family pools are huge, salt water, and super clean. Plenty of poolside lounge chairs and fluffy towels. The poolside staff is excellent and ever-present. Poolside food and drinks were delicious, especially the $12 berry smoothie - totally worth it. The architecture is classically inspired, and although I was at first surprised by all the gold coloring, I got used to it very quickly. The suites are huge! plenty of family friendly space. The valet and housekeeping services were especially good. We did not use the concierge but I overheard them booking a Ferrari for one of the guests. I can't say enough about the staff which was so attentive and helpful. Most everyone remembered my name. There were nice stuffed animals waiting for our kids. We ate at Amaya a few times - breakfast and lunch - and were pleased. We didn't dine at Addison but have heard nothing but great things. The place is quiet and refined -- which is exactly my speed. If you're looking for more action, try other places beachside in Del Mar (L'Auberge comes to mind).

Reviews.Title: “Off the Charts”
Reviews.Author: OhioMaranello
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a property that does everything, and I do mean everything, perfectly? Check in is a breeze. Extremely helpful staff inside the front door and out make arrival as smooth as silk. The lobby is spacious and well appointed, without the we are trying to save space feel found in so many upscale hotels. The common area is adjacent to the bar with live music nightly, some of which was quite good. The bar servers are professional and knowledgeable. The prices for bar food and drink are reasonable given the nature of the hotel, and the selection was remarkable. The lobby is a destination spot in and of itself. Wondering about the rooms? Incredible. The bathroom is a work of art. Spacious and clean with a large soaking tub and walk in shower. The toiletries are as one would expect. The room itself is beautifully appointed with a wonderful closet area as well as a couch and comfortable desk. The bed is perfect with high quality linens. A balcony overlooks the adult only pool area and is beautifully furnished. At the risk of sounding as if I am employed by the hotel, this is one of the nicest rooms I have experienced anywhere. Breakfast is a wonderful time of morning at the Del Mar. Choose to eat on the terrace and there will be no disappointments. The food is outstanding and fairly priced. Ditto lunch. As expected, the staff makes it perfect. The grounds are beyond belief. This property is perfectly maintained and a sight to behold. Two pools. I frequented the adult only side which is 25 meters long and perfect for laps. A large hot tub type pool is adjacent. The pool furniture is very comfortable. The pool food wasn't great but the staff was very attentive and professional. The gym is fully equipped with an excellent selection of free weights and machines, as well as cardio equipment. There is also a yoga studio with daily classes. Rest assured that the Grand Del Mar is one of the nicest hotels in North America. It checks every box and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: tntmcd
Reviews.Content: One of the best resorts our family has visited (and we have stayed at a lot of nice places). The service from the staff was exceptional, from the turn down service, vallet, and providing us with beach chairs/towels/umbrella. The grounds are very well manucured, and although this resort is not on the beach, has much to offer in the way of pools, horse back riding, spa, and golf (not to mention spent the afternoon across from Phil Mickelson and his family at the pool). And the rooms are excellent from the bedding/pillows, marble bathroom, size of the room, to its cleanliness. It is expensive, but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Second time even better!!”
Reviews.Author: surferboyLaHabra
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and I didn't think it could get any better...but it did! We were able to take advantage of more of the services this time around (fitness classes, golf) and we were not disappointed. The staff is as superb as you will find anywhere, the grounds as beautiful as ever, and even the food was a notch above our last stay (if that's possible!). This is our one splurge for the year and it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds. Amazing bath tub!”
Reviews.Author: MsLydia
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and the room was nice, too. I liked the folding door that separated the bedroom from the bathtub. Service was excellent. A safe 5 star hotel to stay. Dining was amazing, very pricey, but an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Why bother going to Italy when The Grand is right in your own backyard?”
Reviews.Author: TravellingRover
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my visit was to check out the spa and 5 Star restaurant for a possible reunion site next year and the experience truly amazed me. From the friendly greetings at valet and Front Desk to the superlative service at both restaurants I was hard pressed to find any enduring flaws. The pool service was the only area that needed improvement as it did take quite a while to get a waitperson and she was not versed in the menu. It was just as well as I ended up having lunch at their 'casual restaurant' which had the best $14 hamburger I've ever had. The waiter was great. Served hot bread (rolls and breadsticks freshly baked) and fresh butter. His suggestion of the grilled garlic lime shrimp salad was wonderful. They use freshly ground angus beef (sirloin) and it came rare as desired and the bun was homemade. The dinner at Addison was also wonderful - the highlight being an incredible cheese gougere served as one of three amuse bouches. An explosion of cheese was like a mouth orgasm. Loved it. The lamb however - supposedly a 'signature dish' was oddly sweet and bland and lacked juice. Not recommended. The sweet pea ravioli was lovely - almost as good as Spago. All the vegetarian options were very creative and highly recommended. Excellent King Crab first course. The rooms were well designed, beds extremely comfortable - outfitted with Pratesi sheets. Great bathroom. There was an annoying green light above the bed (smoke alarm?) that was poorly positioned for people who like a dark environment. I would suggest that housekeeping provide eye masks on request. The feel of the place was like a wonderful Italian palace - lavish and opulent and yet warm and inviting. Perfect place to feel pampered and less than 2 hours from Los Angeles. A real gem of a place that I hope is around for a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “They have it all - luxury, service, activities, food and wine”
Reviews.Author: JFulton
Reviews.Content: One of the better resort properties we have ever stayed in. This is our second visit, but on the first we were with a corporate group, so we did not really get to experience the full treatment until this visit. We are already trying to figure out how we can get back here soon. My take on the place Resort - smacks of luxury from the moment you hit the gate and the long drive up the canyon. While located in an area that has various subdivisions, you never know it once you get on the property (save the homes dotting the ridgelines on either side). Fantastic golf course, tennis courts and pool areas - one adult, 3 family pools. Furnishings, marble, layout, lobby, restaurants, lounge - everything is done exceptionally well. A friend commented that some fine European resorts have taken decades to acheive the level that the GDM has achieved in only a few years. Service - top shelf. From the valet, to check in, the bell hop, everyone is just super. The teenagers wanted smores and they did not have any. Problem? Nope, they loaded them into the house car and off to the 24 hour Vons for smores fixins. Needless to say, the kids are ruined for life, but heck, its vacation. Room- We had a Prado suite which was even better than we hoped for. 1 bedroom suite, but the trick is it has 2 full size bathrooms. Critical when traveling with a teenage girl and a wife who each have their own bathroom routine. I would not get a bigger suite if it did not have that second batroom. Kid is on a pull out, but she says its actually more comfortable than she expected, Furnishings and details inside are all top shelf as well, Only letdown for the device laden family we are - not enough outlets! Food - Did not try their 5 star offering, Addison, but the Amaya was great. See separate review for it, Even the appetizers by the pool were well done. Wine list in the lounge is also quite good. Excellent list of single malts and they have cigars as well as a smoking balcony. Activities - you name it, they have it. Concierge arranged kayaking, snorkleing, horseback riding on the trails surrounding the resort, a beach trip (complete with umbrella, charis etc.). First class all around. I am a runner and if you like trail running you are in luck. The resorts own Shaw Trail connects into the Penasquitos Canyon Preserve on the other side of the south ridge. Lots of climbing but world class trail running, mountain biking and equestrian trails, Fitness Center - very, very good. Spa - looks lovely, but the prices were so high ($100 for a pedicure) that we did not partake. Yes, the GDM is expensive, but worth every penny in our book.

Reviews.Title: “The best you will find in San Diego, maybe Southern California”
Reviews.Author: JasonRattray
Reviews.Content: Most often when my family visits The Grand Del Mar we are with our 2 young children, and the experience is always wonderful. This weekend for our anniversary we left the kids behind and experienced a whole new Grand Del Mar. We have always enjoyed visiting with our kids as the staff is always accommodating, taking all the right steps to insure our kids and family are comfortable and well taken care of. Their children’s pool and resort pools are always live and well-staffed. The kids can enjoy just as much as the adults do. This trip was just as enjoyable but completely different. My wife and I completely avoided the "family" pools and spent all of our time at the relaxation pool. We enjoyed spa treatments at what has to absolutely be the more amazing spa in San Diego County, shopped at the outlets which are stocked with great clothing, candles and other fun items and ate at all of the restaurants. Overall just an amazing experience and a total eye opener when we realized this resort can really do it all. Always a great and fun family experience, and now a luxurious couple’s weekend. Cheers Grand Del Mar!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Newman_travels
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, well placed to explore downtown San Diego and coast. We had planned to stay downtown but as our stay coincided with ComicCon we were unable to get in anywhere- I'm so glad we couldn't, as staying at the Grand Del Mar was far more relaxing. Beautiful, spacious room with very comfortable bed. Staff very attentive. Excellent breakfasts, even though you are given a menu, it seemed that whatever you wanted they would try and accomodate it. Would definitely choose TGDM again.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Romantic Getaway, the Price is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: weedebs
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar is a once in a blue moon treat for me. The price makes it a special occasion destination for me, but it's well worth the price of admission. Don't let the fact that it's not right on the beach deter you from staying here. Once you arrive, you won't want to leave. The rooms are incredible, I don't think i've ever stayed anywhere with rooms like this and I've stayed in some nice places! The food is five star, the spa is to die for and the pools are delightful. . .epsecially the one where kids are not allowed! Families, don't fret, there is a wonderful pool for families as well and a great kids club to boot. They have golf (i don't golf but I hear it's an amazing course), an equestrian center and hiking in the attached nature preserve. Trust me, you won't be bored. All of the above makes it a great place to stay but here's where it becomes amazing in my book. . .the staff. Bellman, Front Desk, Housekeeping, Wait Staff, Bartenders, Management. . .you name it, they are the nicest, most GENUINE, staff i've ever encountered. These people aren't fake, they love their jobs and it shows. Oh yeah, they don't nickel and dime you with a "Resort Fee" or make you pay for bottled water or wireless internet access. . .it's all included. AND the coffee maker in the room is amazing, it's a mini esspresso machine! I highly, highly recommend the Grand Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “It Is My Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: hartz0729
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago with 27 family members. We take a family trip each year and have visited Maui (Kea Lani and Ritz Carlton), Grand Caymon (Ritz Carlton), and taken a Mediterranean and Alaskan Cruise with post-cruise stays at Four Seasons Vancouver. The level of service we received during our stay from top to bottom was head and shoulders above the rest. Upon arrival you immediately feel welcome and at check-in we helped ourselves to a snack of cookies and fruit juice and the delivery of our luggage was very prompt. A call to Housekeeping for more hangars took about five minutes at the most and they provided me with more than I requested. As we walked the beautiful grounds we were immediately relaxed and took in all of the scenic lawns, gardens and firepit areas. Our room was on the second floor (three floors total) and overlooked one of the firepit areas which I noticed in the evening would be popular with guests quietly sipping a glass of wine or just visiting. Each morning my husband and I would play tennis on one of their two courts and either had breakfast at Club M on the weekend or grabbed a quick bite at the Cent Anni Cafe. If looking for a quick and less expensive option, visit Cent Anni as one morning I had a bowl of oatmeal for $5, I believe, and it was served on white china with brown sugar, almonds, and raisins. Others in the family said that the sandwiches served there were delicious. Several of us also enjoyed Amaya for breakfast and dinner as well as the poolside lunch service. We did not try Addison. A few examples of their exemplary service include: 1. Opening Gift Shop up at 10 p.m. so that my niece could get aloe vera for her sunburn. 2. Locating a family member's cane which was lost somewhere within the Resort. 3. Delivering contact solution to another niece who forgot to pack hers in the suitcase. 4. Reserving a few areas for family pics taken by a photographer on our last day. I could go on and on but each and every Grand Del Mar staff member had an attitude of "How may I help you" and "We can get that done". The rooms are gorgeous and we loved the window which opens (or can be shut at night) between the bedroom and bathroom and, of course, my husband loved the tv built into the bathroom mirror. Housekeeping was very efficient and the chocolate covered oreos and gourmet chocolates left on the bed at night were a very nice touch as well as the comp. bottled water. Also, the beds were ultra-comfy. Mid-week they knocked on the door to switch out the padded seat cushions for our balcony chairs. They almost seem to anticipate your needs. One afternoon they set up tables, chairs, and umbrellas to present a wildlife display for the kids with an armadillo, boa constrictor, horned bull frog among others which amused not only my younger nieces and nephews but a few of the adults as well. The fresh lemonade served to all was a nice touch. The amount of activities available within the resort could keep you busy; however, if visiting the area for the first time you will want to visit the Zoo, Legoland, downtown San Diego, etc. They will provide you with precise directions if you drive anywhere or if it is within fourteen miles they can provide comp. car service. It is best to plan ahead so that you are able to reserve the shuttle or car service as I believe quite a few make use of this attractive amenity. Have to mention the mini hot tub for the kiddies. So cute and popular with my nieces and nephews. In closing the Grand Del Mar is the place to stay whether you just want to relax or as a base for sightseeing. We drove south to downtown San Diego and north to Carlsbad and both places took appr. 25-28 minutes as long as we were not driving during rush hour traffic. La Jolla is very close (fifteen minutes) and the village of Del Mar has a lot of nice restaurants and is a twelve minute drive. We went in between the San Diego Fair and Del Mar Thoroughbread Racing Season so traffic was not as congested. Do yourself a favor and make a visit to this haven.

Reviews.Title: “Get's it right”
Reviews.Author: MOAT
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews saying how great the service was and I was a bit skeptical. However, I was very impressed by the level of service and the attitude of all who worked at the hotel. The only place that could use improving is the Amaya restaurant. We didn't dine at Addison, the highly acclaimed gastronomic restaurant at the hotel (because we were with the kids) but I think that the menu at Amaya should be different. It is attempting to be more gastronomic than it truly was. I think a different type of menu would be a good contrast to having the highly rated Addison and the chef isn't up to the menu presented. Also, the management of the restaurant was a bit off. We were kept waiting for 30 minutes for our reservation one night, yet there were many empty tables. Also, the large banquettes inside are horrible, awkward shapes for conversation with spotlights beaming down. The only people I would imagine enjoying these are the middle aged men with their 20 something mall chick girlfriends who were seated in two of them one night we were there. I guess they like to show off their...um..."catch" or that they can still "catch" something? Anyway, I didn't like Amaya but I loved everything else at the hotel. The pool area, the room the service from the pool to the concierge to the front desk...it was all fantastic. And the kids gave very high reviews to the Explorers Club. If they just tweaked Amaya a bit the hotel would be perfect....

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Del Mar is Grand....”
Reviews.Author: caligirl8639
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were going to be dropping off my brother at summer camp in LA, and had a weekend to kill. I was searching on the internet to find where we should stay for a weekend, when I found the Grand Del Mar near San Diego. I live by the reviews on TripAdvisor and to date, it has never led me wrong. The Grand Del Mar is a very tuscan/spanish inspired resort, only 4 years old. It is tucked away, and is very quiet and peaceful. Rooms are very lavish, and the bathroom is very luxurious! Beautiful gold detailings throughout the room, with gorgeous high ceilings. We visited the spa... but the highlight was golf... Expensive, but a beautiful course in which you play 18 holes accompanied by a golf caddy. He cleans your clubs, passes you clubs, radar's your shot from the pin etc. Truly a fun experience ! Service at the hotel is exguisite! Maintenance to valet everyone is there to assist and ensure you are enjoying your stay. Free Wi-fi too all over the resort and in rooms! Will stop by again in a couple years.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: MKL44
Reviews.Content: Really an excellent and relaxing place. After reading the reviews about the hotel I had very high expectations, but the stay there turned out to be even much better than I expected. A couple of days there will be something to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Attention To Detail”
Reviews.Author: Kwas
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful especially at night with the extra special lighting in the canyon. Everyone who works at this resort from the doorman and housekeepers to the grounds keepers smile and acknowledge you. The housekeeping staff learns your personal style in the room and meets those expectations. There is a total "can do, will do, we want to" attitude....it is so refreshing in this day and age. You pay more at this resort but you get ALOT back. When you are looking for the extra special place to stay The Grand Del Mar will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Best!”
Reviews.Author: HotDeeTravels
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Grand Del Mar the past 2 years. This is by far the best hotel in San Diego! The rooms are amazing. We have never stayed in one of the suites, but the guest rooms are huge and beautiful. The bathrooms are exquisite and the tubs in the rooms are GIANT! We would never want to leave the room, but the grounds are exquisite. The pools are massive, the bars have the greatest drinks and the restaurants have everything you could want. We loved the fitness classes and had the opportunity to visit the equestrian center during our stay! Be sure to dine at Addison, which is a masterpiece in itself. It may just be the best dining experience we've ever had. The staff make the resort truly amazing. Everyone is so eager to help you enjoy the resort and take advantage of all of the amenities they offer. We loved the service at the pool, and the concierge Betty helped us plan a wonderful trip around San Diego during our stay. Kurt at the front desk and Christal at Amaya also stood out as wonderful hosts during our stay. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation away from the craziness of San Diego, be sure to visit this Resort! We have already started planning our trip back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jmoss69
Reviews.Content: If you thinking about staying there I want you to know one thing. I travel around Europe and no other country understand hospitality like the europeans especially when it is a five star hotel UNTIL NOW. I can not say enough about my stay at the Grand Del Mar. The place is gorgeous ( I am in High End residential construction in NYC) the quality of the interiors is incredible, the service is impeccable, the food is fantastic; especially the breakfast; the service is impeccable and the people who work there from the bus boys to management are so sincere and genuine in wanting to make sure you are happy and taken care of. I really do not have the words to tell anyone who is thinking about going to please don't miss the chance to experience what everyone who goes experiences . I promise you will be back. I do not have one minor negative comment about The Grand Del Mar

Reviews.Title: “Going to be hard to beat this trip!”
Reviews.Author: Briner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 1 year anniversary and it was perfect! We dedcided to drive in from Vegas... We pulled up to the first check in and offered her our last name. The fantastic service started there. She gave us thourough directions on how to get to the hotel. Once we pulled in the kind valet open our door and said "happy anniversay!" with bottles of water coming to hand, then personally escorted us in. Once we got into our gorgeous room with pool side views we waited maybe 5 min for our luggage. It was then we had the pleasure to meet our favorite personnel there Eric the bellman (awesome!). Eric asked us our plans and we were unsure what to do. He gave us many suggestions and the best was the hotel offers driving service. We called concierge and within 15 min we were in van making our way down to beach. Our driver was so knowledgeable on the property. After a day of fun in the sun we came (ride provided) we came back to our room to find a dessert with a personal letter of anniversary wishes, oh yeah and a bottle of champagne (which we enjoyed a day later poolside). There is many more great experiences i could share about the resort. All in all worth every penny and just amazing for a romantic getaway! From the doorman to poolside attendants to the servers at Amaya. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting for relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Lexi99
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort for a couples getaway! We spent 3 nights. The location is perfect - about 15 minutes away from the coast at Del Mar which meant it was sunny every day while Del Mar had the cloud cover due to being right at the coast. All the amenities you could want to amuse yourself - day and night. Hiking was beautiful and I loved that the doorman saw us coming and realized we'd need some chilled water as we returned. A proper lap pool which is a rarity and it's adult only so you actually can have a beautiful swim. Lunch is served poolside on breakfast-in-bed tables so you needn't leave your chaise. Restaurants are especially amazing and there's also a nightclub which I expected to be a dreary desolate place but it was full and great fun. I was really struck by the level of luxurious detail to this place - both in the service and in the architecture and furnishings. Nothing was spared. I was left with the impression that it was built and maintained by people who are very passionate about this place. It's truly a special place and will definitely transport you to another time and place.

Reviews.Title: “World class customer service and great value”
Reviews.Author: pkmiles
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and nicely appointed rooms. The staff were all extremely helpful and polite at all times of day and nights. Excellent concierge. Free wifi which was appreciated. This hotel was a great value. We rented a three bedroom suite for about 5 nights. We had our two small children and nanny. They were great with the kids, providing a diaper pail in the room w/ o asking and other kids amenities. The only thing that could have been improved was the lighting, rather dark and the room service was not up to par with the rest of the hotel. It wasn't bad, just not great like everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joakimraboff
Reviews.Content: The Grande is truly grand in every sense of the word and literally defines how a resort should be designed; with guests' comfort and enjoyment in constant focus. I've stayed at many fabulous hotels across the world and very seldom do I get impressed in North America as I was during my four nights at the Grand Del Mar. If you've ever been to a 5 star property in South East Asia, (like Raffles in S'pore, The Oriental in Bangkok, or the Peninsula in HK) you will feel right at home here. One of few differences – aside from the somewhat more amiable climate of San Diego – is that the food and wine offered at the Grand holds a far better quality to price ratio than I'm used to at other top notch hotel resorts. I was there on business, but could not help but notice several couples enjoying the romantic atmosphere. Next time around, I'll most definitely bring my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romantic Retreat”
Reviews.Author: jfreeman7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of a week long trip to California. We were celebrating our five year anniversary, and the staff was very kind in recognizing this when we checked in. When we returned from the pool the first afternoon there was a bottle of champagne and a little dessert waiting for us, which we loved. Service was excellent all around, from the front desk to the restaurant, spa, and poolside attendants. We also used the car service to take us into town and the driver was great. The restaurant in La Jolla we visited (Truluck's) was excellent, and we found it through a recommendation from the hotel. I appreciated being contacted before my stay to make reservations, spa appointments, etc. I highly recommend visiting the spa, it was a great experience. All the food we tried on site was delicious, and the drinks by the pool were great, too. The rooms are gorgeous, pools are wonderful and relaxing even when crowded, and room service was very prompt, friendly and tasty when we ordered it for breakfast one morning. We had high expectations after reading all the great reviews, and they were all met! We had a great and memorable anniversary celebration and would love to return here someday.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rate it 6 Stars if it was possible”
Reviews.Author: KandDTravelFans
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar - a hidden gem in the canyons of San Diego. They helped to create an incredibly memorable 10 year anniversary mini-vacation. Hospitality and warmth wrap around everything at The Grand Del Mar. The total experience was the opposite of my pre-conceived snooty high end hotel experience. Here they treat you like a long lost friend - remembering your name, what you like, why you're there and repeatedly thinking of ways to make it even nicer for you (and then doing it!) The restaurants are well done - especially Addison where we enjoyed the best meal of our life. I felt like a princess it was so special from the ride up in the house car (a high end Mercedes!) to leaving three and a half hours later with a gift box of caramels in the awaiting car. Golf is amazing - challenging and accompanied by a caddy that makes it fun and less intimidating. Live music is in several of the venues. Excellent artists, amazing sound system and attentive service. But, most of all what was impressive were the people - to a person they were all amazing - from the porters, valets, front desk, food service teams, golf pros and pool attendants to the housekeepers in the hallways. Somehow the Grand found every genuinely nice person in San Diego and has recruited them to work here! I thought it was high priced (compared to our usual trips) when I booked it but by the time we checked out I thought it was a bargain for all the value and warmth we received over three days. We will always look back fondly on our anniversary weekend spent here and will be returning to enjoy it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: clyons24542001
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property set in the hills and grove lands of Southern California. Outstanding golf resort. World Class Restaurant (Michelin Rated). Impeccable guest service rivaling that of the "big names". Very relaxing resort with a feel of Western European service and achitecture. Very easy and fast access to the coast as well as San Diego.....also easy to Tijuana (although why you would care is beyond me.....:-)

Reviews.Title: “New Feature: Trail Rides”
Reviews.Author: smitham
Reviews.Content: While visiting friends in San Diego in April, I spent a lovely afternoon at the Grand Del Mar (I did not stay overnight). We had lunch at the Club on the terrace. Food and service were excellent, and we had a lovely view onto the golf course and gardens. After lunch, my friend and I went on a trail ride through the hotel grounds. A very scenic experience as the trail meanders over ridges and through a valley. The hotel has just recently established a stable. Not having ridden for over 10 years I was a bit nervous. But Lacy and Jessica, who run the stables and escort the rides were both very capable, providing just the right mix of reassurance, encouragement and helpful hints. The horses were beautiful and well-mannered. The stables - a large loose box for each horse - and arena are also well set up. I would recommend this experience to any golf widow (or widower) staying at the hotel, or just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, best kept secret in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ktbmas
Reviews.Content: Myself and girlfriends stayed at the Grand Del Mar to celebrate birthdays. We had a fabulous time. In less than 24 hours we were immersed in luxury, relaxation and the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. The property is gorgeous, customer service is top notch, rooms are very comfortable and spacious, very relaxing atmosphere everywhere you walk. I can't say anything negative about this place..it is a wonderful escape. Although a little pricey, it is worth every penny. You will walk away relaxed and feel as though you spent a week at a spa. Best hotel I've stayed at in a very long time...you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: attymom
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, surrounded by hills and golf courses. Feels so remote and relaxing. The hotel is first rate. There is a walking trail around the hotel which is awesome. This would make a fantastic venue for a small intimate wedding. Short distance away from the beach and eclectic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and ecellent service”
Reviews.Author: crvcrv
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar is just a beautiful property. The walk to the room may be long, but the rooms are outstanding in their comfort, their size, and their amenities. Service by the attendants at the valet parking, the bell boys, the reception, the room service personnel, even the employees who you run into in the halways was uniformly pleasant and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Grand by name, Grand by nature - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar is truly one of the most outstanding hotels you will ever stay in - I cannot recommend it enough. Set in the grounds of acres of countryside (ideal for golfers), you could be forgiven for thinking you were in Italy or Spain. The luscious grounds and endless swimming pools provide a relaxing stay for anyone looking to 'get away from it all'. As you would expect, customer service is of a very high standard, and everyone is friendly and welcoming. Rooms are divine, I almost got lost in mine it was that big.. especially the bath! The small touches are lovely too - treats delivered to your room every day and hugely comfortable beds. Foodies will love this retreat as it serves some of the finest food the area has to offer - no surprise when you consider there's a Michelin star restaurant on site. The hotel is nestled in a quiet and peaceful area, but it is a taxi ride to the shops, beach and nightlife. (Free WIFI for 24hrs).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: LAFF_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, very elegant, felt like a grand hotel in Europe, except the room was condsiderably larger. I liked the expresso machine for coffee in the morning (very easy to use and everything was provided for it). The staff was welcoming and very gracious, every need attended to. We were upgraded because we booked through this site and we received a resort credit and free breakfast the next day. I would definitely stay there again and book through this site again! LG/ San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Whiteboy7thst
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best hotel I've ever been to. Yes it is expensive, but well worth it. A great place to relax after three weeks touring the USA. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “This place is very nice (and a little advice to the hotel)”
Reviews.Author: misanthropicdreamer
Reviews.Content: We spent a terrific week here in April. I loved most things about this hotel and we plan to return to stay here again. Most of all I liked the friendly staff. When you travel with two children you can always tell if the staff is trained to be kind and helpful to children. This staff has had top training and are wonderful. The rooms are very nice despite the decor which is fake Italian (i.e. mirrors made to look worn and distressed and lights made to look like dripping candles). It is true that you have to walk down endless hallways to get to them but they are nice. I asked not to have any air fresheners placed in our room and they listened. We had a little porch with two chairs facing a golf course. My father had a porch (facing a pretty garden) that was too small for even one chair. A big plus would be an addition of screened doors for the porch because it would be nice to have the fresh air without getting mosquitos in the room. The family pool is not huge but is large enough when the hotel is not too busy. We had it almost to ourselves in April. The landscaping is attractive. The staff is helpful with towels, etc. The first time we used the pool the staff started to clean with a loud smelly machine and we left. I thought they might have waited until it was empty. Also, there was a bit of a mold problem around the pool drain areas that needed to be attended to. The Amaya restaurant is a great place for breakfast and we tried to go there every morning. We liked to sit on their outdoor terrace. The waiters give top notch service and are super friendly. My kids loved the pancakes and the adults liked the salmon bagels. All were happy with the fresh squeezed orange juice. Once the gardner came around just as we sat down and kept mowing the same patch of grass in front of the restaurant. After several of our requests to make him stop a staff person finally went over to ask him to leave. The hotel should arrange that gardeners come after breakfast and before lunch to work in that area. At night the hotel provides a variety of musical entertainers. We stayed up one night to listen to an older guy with a great voice play piano and sing standards. He even obliged us with a request for Billy Joel's "Piano Man" complete with harmonica. The hotel has several walks on it's property and the surrounding area. We were lead by one of the staff to the beginning of two trails that started past the horse stables. We walked on the one that turned right (the less traveled one) and soon noticed that there were ticks crawling all over every one of us! Disgusting. We felt that the hotel should warn the guests that they have a tick problem on these paths and told them so when we returned to shower and change. We took a stroll around the hotel property and were surprised when a dog came barking out of a ground floor room. The owners stopped it before it reached us. It made me think that I would not be very pleased to have a dog barking in a room near me. Not relaxing. The spa is good one. My daughter and I went for a massage at the same time. She liked hers (my only complaint with hers was that the lady had a cold) and I liked mine. For Easter the hotel made it fun for kids by having an egg hunt and other activities. Advice to fellow travelers: stay at this place if you want a relaxed and upscale hotel with great service. Advice for the hotel: Get rid of that awful scented candle that is in the lobby area. It smells very artificial. Also, please get rid of all the fake books and yard sale non-English books that are glued together in the "library" area. Instead, get real books in English that guests can read while visiting you and leave for others. So much more refined and useful!

Reviews.Title: “Polished gem.”
Reviews.Author: sseansully
Reviews.Content: Wife was at the Grand Del Mar on business and I was the pampered spouse. The place is all flowers and marble. The grounds are beautiful, the spaces are, indeed, grand, and the rooms are plush. Service was cordial and attentive. The pool(s) were nice. There's a golf course next to the hotel which was quite fine if pricy. I played twice.

Reviews.Title: “True Five Star Treatment”
Reviews.Author: golfnfoolGreenBay_WI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference April 2-5. Truly word class service in every way. No hesitation to recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels I've ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: Supermac34
Reviews.Content: The Grand del Mar exceeded every expectation I had. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms (even the basic rooms) are huge and luxurious, and the staff was simply amazing. Location: located in Carmel Valley, you are 5-10 minutes away from Del Mar and La Jolla. The hotel has a courtesy car and they were able to drive us to most locations we wanted to visit. Staff: Simply amazing. We were politely greeted by every staff member. The concierge catered to our every need, and the wait staff at Amaya (the cafe at the resort) was superb. The car drivers were excellent as well. Room: Understated luxury. Finest regular hotel room (non suite) I've ever been in. Property: Awesome golf course with great views. The on campus nature walks were great as well. One of the most luxurious hotels I've ever been in, yet everything was very relaxed and not pretentious at all. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to "get away" and be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: thesidekicks
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Grand Del Mar and it was lovely in every way! Friendly staff (we loved Jean-Pierre at the pool), great value at both Amaya and Club M for dining (delicious as well), the spa was relaxing and our room was incredible with an even more incredible view! We often stay at the St. Regis in Monarch Beach and the Montage in Laguna and this property is just as fabulous--even more so in many ways...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...and we have high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLambeau
Reviews.Content: First, we are well travelled guests. We have stayed at many amazing resorts, including (to name a few, but not limited to....) Four Seasons in many locations, Ritz, Capella Pedregal in Cabo, Kea Lani in Maui, many locations in Italy, Trump and Penninsula in Chicago, Atlantis in Bahamas, the Fountain Blue in Miami and most of the high end resorts in Vegas, and the Grand Del Mar is our favorite by far. We were back for our second visit and brought our friends who are also very well travelled and they were completely blown away. The resort is independantly owned and the owner lives in a home on the grounds. You can tell he (Doug) has amazing pride. Every detail was thought through. The first time we stayed here was in terrace room at the adult pool and my husband and I had a wonderful stay. This time we were with our family (3 children-4, 6, and 8) and our friends who also have 2 children. We rented a villa and it was completely rock star. Totally worth the nightly rate and we will be back many times. I am already planning my 40th birthday party there for a destination party with friends. Tennis (most amazing tennis pavillion with great instructors-both Rick and Lynn are great! I have played with both of them and I have gone on tennis trips to saddle brook in tampa), amazing golf course, the kids love the explorers club (free to villa guests), great pools, fire pits all over the resort, and a brand new equestiran center with beautiful retired race horses. We did a group lesson with the kids and a trail ride-very beautiful and the kids loved it and it is steps away from the family pool. We had a meal cooked for us in the villa on the grill and Matt from Amaya was a pleasure to work with and his staff was friendly (jose was great!) and the chef prepared our steaks and sea bass to perfection. what a treat that night was!! The resort will provide a car for you within 15 miles-so you can get to del mar or la jolla for a nice dinner out. For those travelling with kids-legoland was only 20 minutes away and we didnt scratch the surface of all the san diego sites..... We worked with Amanda to plan our stay and activies and she was a complete delight. She was totally accomodating even though we kept changing our minds on daily schedules and activies. I can't say enough. If you can get there either as a couple (I did a spa day the first time I visited and it was amazing!!!) or as a family.....it is a hidden treasure. You will be completely blown away by the beauty of the grounds. If you can swing a villa, the most amazing vacation rental villa I have stepped into....I could go on and on, but totally perfect. My only feedback to management (if they read this) is when you build another phase of villas--PLEASE make them four bedrooms!!! 5000 square feet.....you should have accomodations for 2 families....3 bedrooms just is difficult. That said, it was our favorite spring break and we will be back again and again and again...and if you build a four bedroom villa, we will buy a fractrional share...promise. Thanks for a wonderful trip to the entire staff at the Grand del Mar-especially Amanda, Jon, Jose, Rick and everyone who helped make it a memorable trip!!! Absolutely 5 stars....all the way.... oh, I forgot to mention Amaya...delish!!!! and the workout room was top notch...and our kids loved the explorers club--totatly clean with tons to do!!! Grounds make you feel like you are in europe somewhere....breathtaking

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: this is our 5th time staying at the grand del mar and our trip to san diego is 100% with the intent of staying at the grand. it is like home away from home. the entire property is absolutely opulent and drop dead beautiful. for our past stays we were always put into the same room which we prefer on the 3rd floor overlooking the fairways with a large balcony for privacy, but this time upon check in the new clerk put us in a totally different room with a small balcony without any privacy. unfortunately this was not a good start of our stay needless to say but luckily the front desk manager quickly moved us to our usual preferred room the next day. this time around i noticed the service around the main pool was a bit lacking as well...there were no one to help with towels or the sun umbrella...we had to do it ourselves. the 2 girls that were working at the main pool were busy with food orders that they didn't seem to really care about anything else. golfing on the tom fazio designed course is a real treat...beautiful view and the course is magnificent, quite difficult but we always enjoy our day on the course. we hope to return and let's hope the service will be back to 105% as it has been in the past.

Reviews.Title: “A True 5-Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan41
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8-night spring break stay at the Grand Del Mar with our two young boys. We'd previously stayed at the Aviara under the Four Seasons flag and have also stayed at numerous European and Caribbean luxury hotels. We're high-maintenance guests who ask a lot of room service, concierge and housekeeping staff. The Grand Del Mar delivered at all levels. Our pre-arrival requests were remembered (including the floor and location of our connecting rooms), and housekeeping promptly delivered a fridge and all the other accoutrements we needed for the baby (they'll even sterilize feeding bottles for you!). Even when the hotel was full with a large group, it didn't feel jammed and the staff was still highly responsive to every request, maintaining a stellar attitude across the board. The Grand Del Mar even lacked the usual nickel-and-dime attitude of most hotels. For instance: they don't charge for fitness classes or tennis court time; and there's a small, reasonably priced cafe open 6am-6pm for those early morning lattes and light fare for the kids. The location in Del Mar is also ideal - close to the airport and downtown San Diego, as well as attractions like the zoo and La Jolla, but also beyond the crush of the city and well on the way to Legoland and the Safari Park. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury in a country club setting great for North County”
Reviews.Author: ohcleverusername
Reviews.Content: This is the best luxury hotel in San Diego. If you are visiting for something more oriented toward the north county, like Del Mar or maybe golf at Torrey Pines, this is a great option. It is a bit far if you are visiting on business downtown, though the distance isn't too bad considering San Diego is a very accessible city. Notably, the flagship restaurant, Addison, is well-known to be the best in San Diego. It is very expensive, but worth it for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of, if not the best, hotel experiences that we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: EvelinM
Reviews.Content: From our arrival to our departure, the staff welcomed us warmly and the hotel was just amazing. The suite was in a perfect location with the best amenities possible. In fact, we had a separate his and her bathroom! The hotel is located in a canyon surrounded by residential communities where the locals do not even know that it exists! Make dinner reservations at their signature restaurant, Addison, where the chef may prepare a custom 10 course menu for you. It is a must. You cannot miss an opportunity to visit this secret paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Grand as you would Expect!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We stayed Valentine's Weekend at the Grand Del Mar. We got engaged at this hotel 2 years ago and have since been back to the property but not to stay at the hotel. The overall experience at this resort is definitely 5 star. The service is amazing and the rooms are gorgeous. We stayed in a Grand view King Room which had a view of the golf course and a really good sized balcony. We had spa treatments on the Saturday and that was amazing. I had the body scrub with the Vichy shower and added on a scalp massage (just be aware that they add in the 20% gratuity). The spa is clean and luxurious and very enjoyable. While quite different in decor, this hotel reminds me of the Four Seasons, the staff are very friendly and remember you by name and the rooms are very clean. I would recommend a rain shower in the bathrooms, as the shower heads are a little weak. I would also suggest complimentary sunscreen at the pools (highly recommend the adult pool, huge and very quiet). We could not get into Addison's although we had tried to get reservations a week or so ahead. They said we were at the top of the "waiting list". They never did call us. We ended up having dinner at Amaya. Great food, did not like our table location, right next to the door and the waiter's station. I also did not care for their wine list, hard to follow. However, overall, I would definitely not hesitate to recommend this hotel, while it is far from the beach, you do have more sunshine inland than you would at the coast. They also offer complimentary "shuttle" service into downtown Del Mar. BTW the hotel has a lovely black S500 Mercedes that shuttles you. Not so shabby!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more...”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly amazing and worthy of 5 stars. The rooms are well appointed, the staff is EXTREMELY friendly and the SPA is amazing. Perfect size, cozy and just relaxing. All the other positive reviews were spot on about this place. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Skotti56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights over New Year as part of a 4 hotel tour of California. The Grand Del Mar was the best hotel of our trip by a clear country mile. The level of professionalism from the staff was truly amazing and I would return in a shot. The location is peaceful but only 20 minutes from downtown San Diego. The resort grounds are sprawling and gardens and pool areas are beautiful. Although it is clearly a modern hotel, the grounds are beginning to look well established and the pool areas are great. Different areas for couples and families so everyone can relax. The decor is over the top opulent which works really well in the public areas but is maybe a bit too much in the bedrooms but the rooms were spacious, quiet and exceptionally well equipped (great to have a Nespresso machine). What really sets this hotel apart is the service. Before arriving, we were contacted by a very helpful guest services manager who arranged a meal and taxi transportation for New Year's Eve over a week before we arrived. On arrival (it was our birthday), we received sparkling wine and a cake in the room. On New Year's Eve every guest was offered a complimentary bottle of wine from the in-room bar. You cannot imagine how surprised we were when my wife threw her deodorant in the bin before breakfast one morning, to find two new deodorants and a compliments card on the counter when we returned to the room. In short, they have an exceptionally well trained staff who really go out of their way to anticipate your needs. We were really pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and wine in the hotel. Amaya is no casual bistro and every meal we ate there was beautiful. We particularly appreciated the very well priced kids menu and the fact that we could enjoy fine dining with our children as a family. The restaurant staff were extremely professional and all remebered our names. This is despite the fact that this is a large resort. Attention to detail is superb. What I really appreciated was the fact that although this is not a cheap hotel, I never felt we were over-charged for anything. If you wanted a light breakfast, there was a take-away coffee shop and the prices for food and drinks were very reasonable, the quality superb. Both my sons spent an afternoon at the kids club where the staff actually made things with them and played games rather than leaving them to get on with it with the playstation. My only criticism was that the valets were not the most charming or professional. They were prompt, but didn't have the same attitude as the rest of the staff. So many hotels invest a fortune in the hardware and then mess it up with the service that it was a joy to stay in a hotel where the customer comes first. Don't hesitate to stay here if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Nahas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Del Mar while attending a conference, and plan to return for pleasure. The location is relatively isolated, but if you want to relax for a few days, it is ideal. It is absolutely beautiful and the spa was terrific. The staff were unbelievably friendly, especially room service staff. I ordered breakfast daily and it was the best room service staff I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy establishment”
Reviews.Author: hardtofindaname
Reviews.Content: We arrived new years eve, lovely room miles from reception, but the hotel is sprawling in style. Good exercise. Friendly welcome and nice touch with spiced apple tea at reception. Spa is really nice, great treatments and hot tub area. Did not like the $25 charge from Jan 1 to use the area if you were not having a treatment,seemed mean to me when you are a resident, however the pool at spa is a nice quiet retreat and free. The yoga classes are quite good and I believe the golf course is challenging and well maintained, too expensive though. The buffet breakfast over the weekend was a veritable feast and the staff were very good. The concierge was helpful and recommended some nice restaurants locally. The layout of the resort is really very nice, it is luxurious yet relaxed, the pools, walks, gardens have all been thought out well and it all makes for a very relaxing holiday. I liked the idea of the casual coffee shop for take aways and simple snacks. I loved the fact that there was free wifi everywhere in the hotel. Some lovely art, they should have more information on the artists available for guests in commen areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: avo730
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days with 20 guests at the Grand Del Mar for a recent employee event. As the one responsible for the event planning and preparation, I have certainly experienced my share of headaches. That was not the case at the Grand Del Mar! This resort is pure luxury - without the stuffiness factor. The staff and management go above and beyond the call of duty to make sure you are completely happy with your stay. The rooms are spacious and opulent, yet cozy and warm. The food is served promptly, with style and rivals some of the top restaurants in the area. The grounds, spa, golf and ambience of the resort make you feel as if you have stepped into a mediterranean oasis! My husband and I call this our new "home away from home" - oh, if we could be so lucky! Whether you are considering this property for a leisurely getaway or a business function - you can not go wrong. Absolute perfection.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star All Around!”
Reviews.Author: bkadventures
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Grand del Mar with 80 other people for a 2011 kickoff meeting. The resort is a bit pricy, but it was immaculate and worth the money! Every single person that attended had only phenomincal things to say about the resort. I have traveled quite a bit and the service at this hotel was far beyond exceptional. I arrived a day early and was able to take the courtesy car within a 14 mile radius. The resort is right near Del Mar and La Jolla and I was able to visit the Birch Aquarium and relax in a beautiful spot on the beach. ROOMS - the rooms at the resort are enormous (see photos). I had a standard room that overlooked a nice courtyard. I found the bed to be very comfortable and the room, quiet. There were several plush pillows on the bed which were a mix of soft and slightly firmer, giving you a choice without having to call the conceirge. I slept very well throughout the week. The room had plenty of space for all of my belongings, so I was able to unpack everything when I arrived. I used my laptop throughout the week- the resort's wireless internet was very fast and easy to connect to. The patio was small, but comfortable and no matter where your room is in the resort, it offers a nice view. FOOD - Although I am a picky eater and have several food allergies, the food was superb and the staff was more than willing to customize any meal that I ordered. The menus offer many different options and one of the best things is that there is a cafe where you can order sandwiches, cookies, smoothies, coffee and gelato. This made it easy when I wanted to grab a quick bite and carry it anywhere on the resort to eat. MEETING FACILITIES - The meeting facilities were excellent and the staff went above and beyond to make sure that everything went as planned without any issues. They offered flexible options for meals, meeting space, A/V and other amenities that a group may be looking for. I saw some pictures from weddings that took place there and they were just gorgeous. GOLF & SPA - Our group participated in both and everyone highly recommended them. They prepared boxed lunches for the golfers which they were able to eat in between shots. Overall, I would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: TEEJAY050
Reviews.Content: This hotel simply excels in every category. Super freindly and professional staff, wonderfull restaurants, heated pools, golf, tennis , riding stables are buing built. The rooms are very elegant and expansive. The bathrooms are huge and marble everywhere. We always stay at Four Seasons but the Grand Del Mar easily matched or surpassed a Four Season or a Ritz Carlton hotel. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in the San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAngeleno
Reviews.Content: 5++++ star service and luxurious surroundings. No detail has been overlooked in the build out of this hotel. I've stayed at the Aviara (when it was the Four Seasons), La Costa, Rancho Valencia, and the US Grant, but the expansiveness and general lively atmosphere of the Grand Del Mar just edges them out. Hands down one of the best lobby bars I've been to. The drinks are exceptional and the wine list is well thought out with some unexpected surprises. A very knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating staff makes the experience all the more worthwhile (love those olives...yum!) We've had rooms with a Fairway view and rooms overlooking the fountain by the gym, both were great, although the Fairway view room did not have a large balcony to sit out on. A very relaxing, luxurious stay every time.

Reviews.Title: “Service that easily beats a Four Seasons or Ritz, and a beautiful property to boot.”
Reviews.Author: dpnyc
Reviews.Content: Spectacular property - lush, comfortable, sprawling, well-maintained, comfortable, inviting. We had a standard "Fairway" room which was enormous. Bathroom is very grand, beds were super comfortable. Housekeeping did an outstanding job, and remembered all sorts of little details such as what time of evening my husband likes to have a bucket of ice in the room. The hotel was also superb with our 3 1/2 year old, giving her a present from a toy box when we checked in, and then there were items waiting for her in the room. The restaurants also have good children's menus. We only ate at Amaya (several breakfasts plus one lunch) and it was excellent. Fresh, good food, and great service. But what really stood out the most for us was the level of service provided by every single member of the staff here. They are trained exceptionally well, and really, they could teach other luxury hotels a few things about service. The valets produced our car in record time, offered us directions wherever we were going, plus bottles of water. The concierges were also exceptionally helpful. And just every time you interacted with someone, they really went out of their way to welcome you and attend to whatever it was you needed. An outstanding hotel. We traveled easily to the San Diego Zoo, the Animal Park, Sea World, and La Jolla, although you can certainly choose a hotel that is closer to these spots. Nonetheless, we would do the same all over again given how comfortable and relaxing the Grand Del Mar was. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ellieourdog
Reviews.Content: As others have stated, The Grand Del Mar does not disappoint! What a beautiful place. We traveled with our two young children, ages 9 and 6 and felt that the hotel was most welcoming to having them there. There is a kid's club that has everything a kid could want...xbox, Wii, PlayStation, foosball, air hockey, crafts, etc. There is a pool just right for them....one side was 3' 6" and the other was 4' 6". The service was warm and welcoming. The suite we stayed in was clean and top notch. They catered to every need...with daily room cleaning, daily night turn down of the beds. The beds were luxurious. The carpets were clean. When we go on vacation, we like to stay at a place that is as nice as our home or nicer.....this place fit the bill. You won't be disappointed; stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: janetmixson
Reviews.Content: The Grand Del Mar, which opened about 3 years ago, is absolutely beautiful. No detail is missed. The architecture, design, furnishings, grounds & staff are all top notch, luxurious, welcoming & comfortable. We ate breakfast at Amaya 5 times & lunch once & each was a total pleasure. I eat mostly vegetables so I was disappointed that their veggie soups are made with bacon but other than that it was wonderful. We had dinner at Addison once. The food was great to superb.
