The amuse bouche & roasted cauliflower were incredibly good. I found the decor (upscale clubby) to be incongruous with the exceedingly formal service. The service was formal to the point of being silly - for example, when placing the napkin in my lap, the waiter actually held it with tongs, lest his fingers touch it. I prefer to put my napkin in my own lap but if the waiter is going to do it for me, are tongs necessary? When I asked if the chef would prepare a vegetable plate from the veggies on the menu, I was told "No". I did enjoy the meal I was served. Our room was gorgeous, very large with lots of light & very comfortable. And absolutely quiet. We never heard a sound. The gym is nice & very well outfitted. The spa is gorgeous. We had a couples massage & were both very happy with them. Claude is excellent. The staff is young, capable, very polite, always helpful. The service is as good as it gets. Really everything about the Grand Del Mar is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again to feel pampered.”
Reviews.Author: Louise100_10
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who posted reviews in the past – you made organizing my December 1-10, 2010, trip easy where we stayed in eight different California hotels. This is the most elegant and wonderful place. Thoroughly relaxing rooms. The dining experience was exceptional – best on this trip. Their location isn’t on GPS, so take a map. It’s pricey, but they make you feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Fashioned Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days while we were visiting family and friends in the area. We usually stay at a different hotel in Rancho Santa Fe but decided to try the Grand this time. The best part about the Grand is the staff who are all amazing. They do an excellent job training everyone. The location is in a beautiful valley inland from Del Mar- this is a plus because it can be sunny at the hotel while overcast on the coast. We had a Palazzo Suite that overlooked the golf course and it was really relaxing. The room was huge with 2 full bathrooms and a little kitchenette. They style of the room was not my favorite- very old fashioned. The lobby was festive with Christmas decorations everywhere and a nice touch was hot apple cider in the evenings. A few negatives: The room service was a little spotty. We got a salad one night with hair in it. When we told the In room dining, they sent us a new one and removed the charge from our bill. One morning I got caffeinated tea when I asked for decaf and an opened and used mini jam jar! gross. Another negative was in the design of the hotel- nothing to do with the staff- but it is really long and spread out. This would be fine if you could drive your car to the part of the hotel you were staying in or the rooms were in little bungalows. Our room was at the far end of the hotel from the lobby/valet/ restaurants so it took FOREVER to walk down the never ending halls to our room. Especially carpeted halls in high heels. It was a little creepy too because there were no windows, it was just hall after hall... I did not like this. Also they had live music Wed- Sat night (a plus- it was pretty good) but it seamed to attract a very elderly crowd so it was not very lively.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little getaway”
Reviews.Author: abdott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay in heaven!!! We travel all over the world, and it has been a long time since we were this excited about a property. It is hard to believe that you are in Del Mar and not Tuscany. The hotel is stunning- the rooms, the lobby, the restaurants!!! However, the most amazing thing about this property is the service- everyone is truly concerned about your well-being here- from the doorman to the waiters to the management personnel. We have been Four Seasons people for a long time, but we honestly feel this hotel beats them!!! We will be going back every year from now on- life is too short - treat yourself to a weekend here. Many thanks, The Olearys

Reviews.Title: “Still grand and luxurious, a real treat”
Reviews.Author: jzwy2000
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here in the past and attended various business and charitable functions. I loved the drive from the gate to the hotel lobby the very first time I visited. The decor is old world glamour, with gold and marble everywhere. Some may not like it because it is old fashioned for a new hotel, but I really dig it. Service is great. The room could be far from the lobby and would be a hike to go anywhere, but I didn't mind it. Overall, this is a great property.

Reviews.Title: “4.999....almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: With the exception of an issue with sediment coming from pipes that was eventually fixed (thanks in part to Michelle at the front desk) the two and a half days spent at this hotel were exceptional. I was not blown away by either the service or the food, but the hotel itself is stunning. The pool area near the tennis courts is wonderful, probably one reason I would return. The adult pool was for the serious lap folks and wasn't relaxing. The spa is amazing and the staff at the spa top notch. It is not a huge property but a litte confusing to find your way around (maps at the concierge desk!) Nice that they do not charge for wifi and $15 nightly parking rate is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: silverius1
Reviews.Content: This resort hotel was beautiful and the service was outstanding, however you pay for the service and ammenities. I would have given it a 5 star except for the Amaya restaurant. We had reservation for the restaurant at 8:15pm. We arrived 10 minutes early and were told that they were setting up our table. After a 20 minute wait they told us it would be another 20 minutes, finally at 9:00 pm they told us we wouldn't be getting a table because there were none available for at least another hour. They offered us a table outside (cold and minimal heaters). We tried it but too cold, then we went back inside and they put us a couple and 2 toddlers at a huge round table and said if you all just sit on one side it will be cozy, but its all we have for you. Not very impressive service from such a resort. Tot heir credit the next morning when we told some of the staff about it, they did try to rectify the situation for us by picking up our breakfast and sending a nice little gift to the room. Still kinda soured the overnight trip which was a birthday gift my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Elegance”
Reviews.Author: emquad46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the The Grand Del Mar from Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The architectural design, the meticulous flower arrangements, the beautiful gardens, the well designed guest rooms with impeccable amenities were at the top level of hotel / resort experience. The golf course is a challenge and is well maintained. I was driven to the golf course from the hotel in Mercedes S550. The attention to my my needs was excellent. My wife said the spa experience was a level above the Borgata Hotel in Atlantic City and the Encore Hotel in Las Vegas. The dining experience at Addison was excellent and can only be appreciated if one has dined at other 5 star restaurants. The staff is well trained and very professional. The Amaya restaurant was excellent for Breakfast and dinner. The art and sculptures are museum quality.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel I have ever stayed at...and I've been to some $$$$$ hotels.”
Reviews.Author: CEBarnes
Reviews.Content: The overall architecture and landscaping inspires awe. This is one 'spare-no-expense' property. The golf course goes on for miles. And, the restaurants are something magical. They prepare food that is so perfect it boggles the mind to imagine something better. Oh, and then there is the bill, this place was the best value ever...bordering on cheap. I stayed at the Mandarin in NYC, Four Seasons in Vancouver, Fairmont all over the place, and this place made those properties seem like ghettos in need of renovation. Though it is off the beaten path, The Grand makes San Diego a world class destination.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: pppp4040
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, if you get the chance visit. The attention to detail, service and whole look of the hotel is just amazing Simply the best hotel we have stayed at, and we have been lucky to stay at some good ones,.....Ritz Carlton, Emirates Palace etc The spa is to a standard i did not believe existed........would highly recommend hotel

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: urami
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed this hotel, it was a comfortable stay, the beds were soft and everything was clean and well kept. The hotel staff did their best to answer all of our questions, they were very friendly. Overall we had a very good time staying here, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing despite a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: holiday10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and a real gem. The previous reviews say it all really. We were upgraded on arrival as it was our wedding anniversary and they later left wine and cake in the room which was a lovely touch. The room was massive, great bathroom, big seating area and nice balcony to sit out. I just have to mention a couple of things that really put us off. The relaxation pool is great -adult only and no mobiles. The only problem was the pool staff were a little too relaxed themselves. Sometimes you wouldn't see them for a long time (they seem to hide inside somehwere). When they were there you had to ask for iced water and refills. I would have expected them to be a bit more proactive! Secondly we had dinner one night in Amaya and after we were seated we were completely forgotten about for at least 20 minutes despite 4 waiters being in that part of the restaurant. We later established that the lady that seated us forgot to tell the waiters. They apologised and offered us drinks or dessert but left a bad feeling.The food in the restaurant is lovely though. All in all a great hotel. The coffee shop is great for snacks and drinks in the day when you dont want to have a meal. The shuttle service is useful but gets booked up quickly so you need to book with concierge. Altogether a great stay but it just felt as though management weren't quite on top of it and service sometimes suffered. Having said that i'd be back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rambling_Canuck
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel. My room was spectacular. The staff was very friendly. Food was excellent. Top notch all around. The hotel was a far distance from central San Diego, so isn't practical if you plan to spend a lot of time right in the city. Arranging and waiting for taxis always seemed to be a bit of a gong show, which is surprising for a hotel of this caliber. Overall experience was fantastic, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: CaboLover18
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved everything about this hotel! It is approximately a 20 minute drive from the San Diego airport and not too far from neighboring towns to visit such as La Jolla, Del Mar, Old Town, Encinitas, Solana Beach and downtown San Diego with the trendy Gas Lamp Quarter. The drive up to this gorgeous property makes you feel as though you are staying at someone’s estate. The hotel is truly beautiful inside and out, and is immaculately kept. They have an exceptional staff, in which all provided excellent customer service throughout our stay. Concierge was of the utmost assistance. It is the little things that make a vacation special, enjoyable and memorable, and listed are just a few to mention...Loved the complimentary shuttle service provided! VIP all the way! The turndown service with the list of daily activities each day and weather, along with the yummy chocolate covered Oreos left next to your pillow each night and complimentary water at your bedside. The newspaper arriving on the door every morning. The beautiful rooms with such pretty views of the courtyard, the golf course or rolling mountains that surround the property! The beds are so comfortable and the bathrooms are nice and spacious with a large shower and soaking tub. Large closet and separate toilet area and loved to be able to watch the TV in the bathroom while showering or just brushing my teeth! The gym and spa looked very nice as well, although we did not use them during our stay. The hotel restaurants were wonderful. We had delicious breakfast and dinner at Amaya, which has indoor and outdoor seating. Addison was exclusive 5 star-dining with a highly knowledgeable and pleasant staff explaining every detail to each course, if requested (as we did :). Club M opened on the hotel property the week of our visit and it seemed to be a popular spot for the locals as well as hotel guests. I also have to mention the amazing Flamenco band- Javid & Naoko, that played in the stunning lobby one night. The pools were always spotless and are heated. There are fire pits outside to enjoy under a beautiful moonlit sky and also fireplaces inside throughout the lobby area to get cozy by. Gorgeous huge vibrant flower arrangements are in the lobby. I can just go on and on about all the things that stood out about this hotel, as you can tell I really loved this hotel and miss it terribly! My Aunt and I felt pampered, spoiled, and treated like queens at The Grand Del Mar and would highly recommend it to everyone. This hotel surely lives up to its name and well deserves the #1 spot on this trip advisor site!

Reviews.Title: “Who Could Ask For Anything More”
Reviews.Author: galsid
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out every facet of our recent stay at the Grand Del Mar was superb. Th grounds are pristine; the staff does everthing it their power to make your stay totally enjoyable. It was hard for us to leave the complex to do any sightseeing and though we had made dinner reservations in advance for our stay in San Diego, we chose to cancel them and enjoy the resort's restaurants which exceeded our expectations in ambiance and cuisine. The only negative experience came afetr checkout when we exityed the resort and went back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “So great, we just lounged in our room all evening!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_GreenEyes
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the hotel to just relax and it was exactly that! I am in love with the lemonade they served at check in....i was craving it the next day, but we left before they put it out! After check in, we went to our room, which was a regular room, but it felt like a suite! Their beds are nothing like the typical hotel bed...you lay down and are so comfortable it is hard to get out! The attention to detail in the entire hotel is amazing, just walking thru it, you see something different each time. My favorite part is that you can walk in your heels on the grass and they don't sink in, that is a designer thinking ahead! Every woman should thank that person! We used the hot tub in the evening and were the only folks in there, it was very relaxing and very romantic! We enjoyed the fitness center, walked around the beautiful grounds and took a swim in the spa pool - so calm and serene. I will be heading back to this hotel in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal41
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night here but loved the experience and will definitely be back as soon as I can! The spa is as good as it gets- luxury amenities with a steam room, sauna and whirlpool. The Grand Del mar is not near Downtown SD so it's a bit far if you want to spend time down there but it's great if you are looking for a quiet retreat. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Jerked me around”
Reviews.Author: bobinoa
Reviews.Content: I attended a large wedding at the hotel and used valet to park my car. When I got home that night I noticed my car (an S550 mercedes) was damaged. I contacted the hotel the next day and they told me to drive there (about 45 minute drive each way) and they would handle it. I went, waited about an hour for them to check it out. Was told their insurance company would take care of it. I drove my 45 minutes home. They did not get back to me. After a follow up they had their insurance company call me and tell me that that regardless of anything, the fact that I didnt notice or report the damage before leading the hotel they would not cover it under and conditions. Why did they jerk me around and have me spend 3 hours of my time on a fruitless trip up there??? So I called the hotel general manager who proceeded to continue to not take responsibility. 'What did you think? We would just write you a check?' Unfortunately for them, this is the attitude of the boss and this is the attitude at this hotel. Better to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Gradeful elegance in a well placed location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: voa
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this beautiful property .We were in a lower floor Fairway view room so the view was not as good as other rooms elsewhere BUT the room itself was large with a superb and very spacious bathroom and a small, sunny- in- the- afternoon balcony.There was no noise and the housekeepers kept it spotlessly clean.We could not have been happier even if we had a suite. The public rooms are very grand and wonderfully appointed and we wish we had had less jet lag to enjoy the ambience of the lounges at night.Having spent all our days touring and walking we were early to bed. The hotel is in spectacular grounds and although it lends itself to weddings and corporate functions these were kept well away from hotel guests, with their own staff, so that there was no interfrerence or inconvenience. The breakfasts are excellent and a room and breakfast rate is well worth negotiating for as the food allowance is more than adequiate. The hotel is well placed north of the city and access to the beaches and smaller towns of North County coastal is very easy and well worth the effort where you can find unique shopping and small family run restaurants for evening meals.The sea is cold but walking is so easy and relaxing as the beaches are sparsely populated. The famous zoo is well worth a visit (and we are in our 50's). There are excellent factory outlet stores to the north and the local outdoor shopping malls are very pleasant to visit with plenty of different eating options. A Sat Nav proved to be a god send as the city freeways are very complex and driving proved to be so much more relaxed for being told where to go!We took our own, having paid for the maps for the western half of the USA before going.Hiring a sat nav is now easy but charges vary and some negotiation is called for. We would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: NürnbergSusanne
Reviews.Content: The Grand del Mar is beautiful, this is one of the few 5 star hotels in the US that can keep up with the European 5 star standard. Everything is of great quality, and not only appears to be. The furnishings in the entire hotel are vary tasteful. The pool facilities are gorgeous and please everybody by having a quiet pool for adults, another one for children and an extra one for babies and toddlers. We had snacks at the pool and ate at the Amaya restaurant every evening of our 3 night stay because it was so nice. The seating outside is beautiful and you are not rushed like in many restaurants in US. Service was excellent. We stayed here with two children 9 and 14 and really enjoyed our stay. Unfortunately we are not golfers, but I am sure the golfing is also excellent

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best all round Service Experience I've encountered.”
Reviews.Author: LesAlanos
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been fortunate over the last few years to stay at a number of genuine 5 star hotels, many of which we've selected after consulting Trip Advisor. This year after reading a number of reviews, and after correspondance with the Hotel we chose to stay here. Whilst a little more than we wanted to pay we made sacrifices elsewhere so that we could stay within our overall budget.(We were on a three week road trip). In summary: Pre-visit: We had excellent correspondance with Brianne and Josh in the Sales team ahead of our visit, with Brianne in particular helping to arrange restuarants, and Josh making a number of valuable recomendations. They continued to offer support and excellent service throughout our stay. Check in and arrival: After speaking with the hotel team we arrived at 12.30PM knowing that we could use the facilities whilst waiting for the room to be made ready. The valet, and Bell Boys did a great job and our first impression was extremely positive! The check in team were equally welcoming, and promised to get a "rush on" so that we could be in our room quickly. One we were told was almost ready. Great we thought, albeit the early check in did not arise, and I had to chase up the front office team. Jon the Front Office Manager got involved and recognised that there was a problem and made great efforts to get us into our room, and ensured that we recieved excellent service whilst waiting. This excellent service continued for the duration of the stay. Room: Many of the reviews on here "wax lyrical" about the rooms and we concur with all the positive comments. Hotel and facilities: The Swimming Pool, Spa, and Gym were first class, with the Service around the Pool the best we've come across. Jason and the team ensured a pleasant and restful time was add. Restuarants: With the exception of Addison we ate and drank at all of the Bars and Restaurants. We personally prefered breakfast at the Golf Club, Lunch by the pool, and Evening Meal at the Golf Club or in Amaya. We finished most nights in the wonderful bar area with a cocktail. At each location the Service was excellent and the Food Quality befitting of a Five Star Hotel! Golf: Whilst staying at the Hotel we played at Torrey Pines, and at the Grand Del Mar. The course here was in better shape, and a real test of Golf. All the staff associated with the Golf course were a credit to the Hotel. We particularly enjoyed using the practice facilties. General: What made an excellent stay into an unforgettable experience were the little extras. From the gifts in the room for special occasions to the courtesy car which we took advantage of. As mentioned by many what sets this hotel apart is the Service provided by the finest staff that i've come across on my travels. All of the Staff we encountered genuinely appeared to enjoy working here, and took great pride in the Service we offered. We arrived at the Hotel as Guests and we felt that we left as friends, no higher complement can I give. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Facility + Sublime Service = Extraordinary Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tropean
Reviews.Content: My wife and four children spent three incredible nights at the Grand Del Mar. The only disappointment was having to leave. I could go on and on, but a quick highlights: A week or so before our arrival I received a call from Nicholle (sp?), the customer service representative who had been assigned to us. She inquired as to what she could do to make our stay more pleasant, if there were any special needs, if she could answer any questions, etc. I mentioned that the purpose of our trip was to drop our oldest off at college, and that the day of our check-out was our youngest's 11th birthday. Sure enough, on our first evening in the hotel, room service appeared with a wonderful pastry and fruit arrangement, and on the dish was written (in chocolate sauce) "Good Luck in College!". And on the night before our check-out a similar, but different, arrangement appeared wishing our youngest a happy birthday. No additional charge, I didn't have to ask for it, just outstanding customer service. The hotel is incredibly beautiful, the staff is attentive, and the whole experience just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: caroldean
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1 to 10 we would rate this hotel 20!! We have stayed in 5 star hotels but this was by far the nicest we have encountered. As well as being beautiful it was very romantic. The staff and service were extraordinary and everything about the hotel was GRAND!!! We were upgraded to a plush, fabulous suite, which was very elegant and overlooked the Relaxation pool. The pool had a music system that was under the water and so relaxing when swimming. We were booked for two nights but I wish we had booked for a longer stay. All the amenities were wonderful. The daily activities were superb and the instructors were excellent. We had the golf package and the course was delightful to play. The breakfast was outstanding and next time we will have dinner at the Amaya. All in all I can't say enough about this hotel. I am already looking at the calendar to see when we can return for another delightful experience. Carol High

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb! So good we stayed and extra night and didnt even visit San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: As part of our road trip from San Francisco we wanted to head down to San Diego before heading back to LA to fly home to Australia and had picked out a hotel in San Diego before reading a review from another tripadvisor advising to give San Diego hotels a miss and for a few dollars more stay at The Grand. We went into their website and after viewing the property immediately booked two nights. Upon arriving at the front gate of the complex we were checked by a security guard and given a valet parking ticket and allowed to enter. The driveway up to the complex and surrounding areas was stunning with the golf course around us. Driving up through the gates to the Hotel it was simply stunning, with the helicopter pad on one side and such lush gardens and surrounds. We were welcomed warmly in the driveway and our bags uppacked and taken to our rooms while we checked in and were offered wonderful home made lemonade. A wedding party was arriving as we checked it and the area was crowded but it didnt take away from gorgeous public rooms and flower arrangements. Check in was efficient and in fact at that time we had hardly seen any of the hotel other than the grounds and foyer but we immediately felt that we wanted to have our "spare night" at this property. We had booked a Grand King room, with breakfast each day (up to the value of $65usdollars) and this included valet parking and 20% off any retail products we purchased, it also came with an upgrade room. The hotel is gorgeous and we had an unbelivable room, with an enormeous bathroom, huge tub, double sink and plenty of vanity space, huge shower, separate toilet and walk in robe off the bathroom area. The hallway also had a wonderful timber wall unit with glass cabinets that held the glasses and mini bar products and also had a sink and water as well as the standard mini bar fridge, the good thing was it was not one of those automated ones, so we could store our own beverages in there, and as we still had champagne form our trip to the Napa Valley this came in handy. Also a bottle of champagne and a special desert was delivered to our room with a note from the manager wishing us a Happy 25th Wedding anniversay - very nice touch. The room was large and well appointed with a king bed, a separate make up dressing table, a large plasma tv another desk area and a lounge chair. Stepping out through glass patio doors we had a little patio area with chairs and table (although one chair was missing they soon found it). From there we went out a little gate and three steps later were at the Adults only pool. It was wonderful to have a pool for adults only as well as a spa as not everyone has children and in such a wonderful relaxing resorts its nice to have quiet time without other peoples children intruding on your quiet time. The family pool area was on the other side of the complex. The service from all the staff was exceptional and particulary around the pool area, where staff provided complimentary magazines, sun glasses, sun tan lotion, bottled water and frozen grapes. The restaurants are amazing. Amaya has wonderful fire places and great food try the lobster bisque and their other lobster signature dish, it was so good we had it two nights out of the three we were there. The other night we ate at their fine dining restuarant Addisons. The meal was wonderful and the service exceptional and also for a quality signature restaurant very reasonably priced compared to some of the other signature restaurants we have been in our trip. The hotel has a complimentary car service that takes guests anywhere they want with in 14 mile radious and we used this service to go into La Jolla, but they also took us a few mintues down the road to the restaurant in a lovely mercedes and then collected us after our meal. The hotel and its facilities were so wonderful that we didnt even get into San Diego we just enjoyed the resort so much and as we had been away almost eight weeks at this stage we deserved the well earned down time. If you dont have valet parking included in your room rate its a very reasonable $15.USD per day. This is one very special hotel and golf club and we will definately be back. We have decided never to stay in LA again but to hire a car and drive the two hours to Del Mar before we have to fly back to Australia. Amazing staff especially the boys at the front in valet parking, how they always remembered out names was amazing. A truly special experience. Cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jazzycazzy36
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. We've been back home for two weeks and can't stop thinking about this great resort. Service was outstanding. We felt like we were the only people there. From the golf and tennis to the pool and fire pits, everything was perfect. Well worth the $345 per night (AAA rate). It's a 20 minutes drive from downtown San Diego and a short drive to Pacific Coast Highway for a scenic drive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Fantastic Stay, Amazing Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megkfrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Our original hotel was overbooked and did not have a room for us, they sent us here and we did not want to leave! This hotel is gorgeous inside and out. The rooms are spacious, and comfortable. The grounds are impeccable. Having young children 4 and 1, we went straight to the pools. They were heated to the perfect temperature. I especially enjoyed the baby pool which only went to a depth of 1.5 feet. The service was amazing. I asked for a port-a-crib and delivered to me was a full size crib with cute bedding, a rubber duckie, and a set of baby toiletries. Also, at check-in they offered us some lemonade and cookies. My son wanted a cookie, but they were out. After our trip to the pool, I returned to find a plate of cookies and a hand written note from Jaime at the front desk. She just wanted to make sure my sons were able to enjoy a cookie. So thoughtful, and meant a lot to me! Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, and helpful! All in all I would absolutely return, but maybe for a weekend away without my children, or when they are a little older. Not that it wasn't family friendly, but I did feel it was a little quiet, and some of the other guests wouldn't enjoy my wild boys running around.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if you want to feel pampered”
Reviews.Author: Soccermum21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a hectic roadtrip. This hotel has 5 stars and 5 diamonds...and it's easy to see why. From the minute we drove up to the door, it was like getting off the world. The service is impeccable. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and quiet. The views are even more beautiful. The food is wonderful. There is so much to do...or not do, it's up to you. The only downside was discovering that we had been charged for valet parking, on settling the bill. This hotel is set out of town and is not cheap. Free valet parking would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “On the surface it seemed like a luxury hotel, but the hotel did not deliver”
Reviews.Author: Seattle234
Reviews.Content: We just recently traveled to the hotel for 2 nights with our 2 young children. We were drawn to the hotel as it had great suites, was family friendly and had supposedly had amazing service. Before we traveled, we received an email from the hotel's guest services asking us more details about our stay so that they could accomodate any requests. We requested a crib and a high chair and early check in since check in was scheduled for 4pm and we were arriving around noon. I was pleased to see the email from guest services as it seemed to set a nice tone for our arrival. When we arrived (around 1:30pm), we were told our room wasn't ready. We were a little disappointed but didn't really mind waiting. When I asked how long it would be, she said she would request a "rush" on the room for us. I also noticed that our room rate was incorrect and showed them a print out of our confirmation with our room rate. They said they would have to check with a manager. An hour and 45 minutes later, I checked in with the front desk again to see if our room was ready and they said they were just finishing up. Another 45 minutes after that (at 4pm...normal check in time), our room was available. Since we had our 2 small children, a 2 and 1/2 hr wait and the "rush" that the front desk promised but we didn't seem to get, set a bad tone for the rest of the stay. I later received a call from the hotel stating that the manager would "honor" my confirmed rate which I found the the way they handled it funny because they acted as if they were doing us a favor even though I had print out of our confirmation clearly stating what our booked rate was. We stayed in a Prado suite and the room was great. They also had cute animal travel neck pillows as gifts for our children which was a nice touch. The pools were great and they would bring out complimentary treats (mini oreo shakes, frozen pineapple). The hotel had turndown service which included bottled water until we received a used bottle of water. We also had breakfast at Amaya (brioche french toast was probably the best we've ever had)...service was great until the server just forgot about us and forgot to bring us our bill. Finally to top off the trip, when we got home, the bill was incorrect and I had to contact them as they overcharged us. Overall, we were very disappointed in our stay especially considering we're paying $700/night. The staff was all very friendly, but they just didn't deliver or we were just plagued with really really bad luck. We've stayed a the four seasons normally, and we'll probably stick to them as their service is impeccable. Pros: family friendly, valet parking was only $15/day + cars were ready for you immediatly, brioche french toast

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLTPA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a few days at The Grand Del Mar, what an amazing hotel! I've stayed at some of the nicest hotels in the world and the Grand Del Mar was my best experience. The property is beyond beautiful--the grounds, golf course, pools, fire pit, views, are incredible. The building and rooms spare no expense. I've never seen a hotel so well appointed with marble, hardwoods, paintings, fireplaces, and high-end furniture. You really need to see this beautiful property to appreciate it. The service was exceptional, and the food was fantastic. Every conceivable detail was thought through, right down to the turn down service that features a plate of hand-made gourmet chocolates unlike anything else I've tried. They really treat you like royalty, I will definetly return. My wife and traveled with our 7 year old and the hotel is very family friendly. My compliments to the management and staff, they understand what it takes to run a five star resort and then take it to another level. Book through Amex and you will receive over $150 of resort credit and an upgraded suite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WoodhamWanderer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at San Diego to be told that we had chosen to holiday during "June gloom". There is a maritime haze around the coast in June - however, The Grand is situated in land, so luckily we were only affected by this on 2 days out of our 8 day stay. We were made incredibly welcome from the moment we arrived. We've stayed at some great hotels over the years, but I would say that this was the best. The hotel is a bit remote, and we didn't want to hire a car, so we were told that we could make use of the courtesy car service - which we did nearly every day. The service goes a maximum of 14 miles from the hotel, so we went to Del Mar, and La Jolia, and to Solana Beach train station, where we caught either the Amtrak or the Coaster to San Diego. We told the hotel the arrival time of our train, and the driver was at the station waiting for us. It is a fantastic service. We ate in the hotel restaurant every day for beakfast, and every evening, except for the evening when we ate at The Addison, which is the hotel's signature restaurant. The food was excellent, but not cheap, but the breakfasts are huge, so we found that we didn't want to eat until the evening. The staff could not do enough to make our stay enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble. We emailed to say that we would like a coffee maker in the room, and were pleasantly surprised to find it there when we arrived. The adult only pool area is great. Towels are laid out on really comfortable loungers, and iced water automatically provided. I can't praise this hotel enough, and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: caratex
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel! Didn't want to leave!!!! The restaurant, pools, grounds, staff, everything about it was awesome. If you can stay at the Grand Del Mar, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand del Mar because my husband was attending a conference at the hotel. We booked a different hotel for our last three nights in San Diego but wished we had just stayed at the Grand del Mar as it was a fantastic experience. We were stunned by the level of service at this hotel. Most of the staff could not do enough to help you and constantly offered us service above and beyond that required. We were very impressed by the room. It was extremely comfortable and quiet and exceptionally well cleaned. The bathtub and shower were both large and comfortable. More water pressure would be nice in the shower but I do understand the need to conserve water. The public areas of the hotel are very attractive as well. We played golf on the very nice golf course. Fortunately we were able to get the twilight rate as the regular rate is extremely expensive. The golf course was empty and I suspect that is because of the high prices. If you are willing to pay to golf bring your own clubs because the rentals are $85 for a round which is very steep. I spent two wonderful afternoons at the tranquility pool and enjoyed it very much. A chair cover and towels are laid out for you when you arrive and you will be offered a glass of ice water as well. Through out the day small drinks and frozen grapes are also offered. I had lunch out at the pool one afternoon and while good it was not worth $25 for a salad and a diet coke. There is a sign restricting access to adults only. For some reason a number of families ignored this and walked through but none stayed. There is also a sign stating no cell phones but most (to my disgust!) also chose to ignore this. It is not very tranquil to have a loud one-sided conversion going on beside you. The polite people got up and left the area when they got a call. I would love to see people leave the phones in their rooms and enjoy an afternoon not connected. I had breakfast at the resort three mornings and was shocked by the prices. The orange juice was the best I have ever had but at $6 it should be. One day my breakfast was $34 including a tip for an omlet, coffee and juice (yes that is the price for one person). The service is outstanding but this is too much for a meal. Breakfast at the golf course grill is a better deal and just as tasty with the added bonus of the view of the course. The resort is quite a distance from other restaurants or I would have left the resort for my meals because of the excessive prices. Overall it is a fantastic hotel with great service but the extras such as food and golf are too high even for a high end resort. I can not imagine what it would cost to feed a family while on vacation at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Excellence”
Reviews.Author: windycty
Reviews.Content: This was one of the BEST hotels that we have ever stayed at. We came upon this place after having a HORRIBLE experience at Paradise Point in Mission Bay. We called them early in the morning after waking up at Paradise to homeless people outside our bungalow among a hundred of other things! We told them of our situation and they were able to help tremendously. They were so helpful. She stated that we should be able to get into our room by noon. (and we did not pay much more per night as we were at Paradise). Everyone there was so kind and helpful, down to the very last detail. You can tell the hotel management wants to have their guests treated like royalty no matter who you are and you definitely feel like that. All the staff was just simply wonderful! The rooms were quite amazing. the linens on the bedding was SO soft and the bed was ultra comfortable. The decor was beautiful throughout the hotel and very charming. The pool area was quite nice as well. The kids enjoyed having the pool basically to themselves during the week before the weekend crown arrived. The weather was quite cool while we were there, but it did not keep them out of the pool as they were able to swim with the heat turned up!!! We did eat at the restaurant once and then were out and about most of the other times, so I am not sure how to rate the restaurants. The only thing thatI wished for was an in room coffee maker...with three little ones, I needed my pick me up more than usual and 6 dollars a coffee was quite costly. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!! This was true paradise!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have visited, but unsettled by politics of owner”
Reviews.Author: SDP_MSN
Reviews.Content: My entire family loved this hotel. It was certainly expensive, but still represented good value for the money. The rooms are large and comfortable, according great views, even the shampoos and soaps were outstanding. I loved the hospitality of the staff. They are youthful and friendly-- I don't think I saw an employee at the hotel who looked older than 30. The staff were well trained, professional, truly outstanding. The hotel grounds were delightful. My children left saying that they couldn't wait to return. I am a critical traveller and cannot think of one complaint about this property. In fact, when we were checking out, I asked to speak to the manager to offer my compliments and also intended to send a glowing letter to the owner. I almost wish that I had not done this because during the conversation, I learned that the hotel is owned by Doug Manchester. He is a controversial businessperson who has made media headlines because of his financing of conservative social policy issues. Of course, everyone has a right to support what they wish. But had I know this beforehand, I probably would not have chosen to support this business, worrying that my money was being used, in part, to support causes I do not believe in. I was sort of heartbroken because this is a property I would have liked to return to, but probably will not because the owner is very public about his views, and making them so public sort of ties this to his business in a way that private behavior would not. Of course, TripAdvisor is not about politics and the hotel is fabulous. I share this only because I wish I had known this information before my booking (I had read about Doug Manchester, but didn't know this was one of his hotels). . .many might not care about such matters in selecting a hotel. Details on both sides of the issues can be found by googling the owners name.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service with great attention to detail!!”
Reviews.Author: surferboyLaHabra
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a weekend retreat with colleagues and was literally blown away by the care and attention to guests from the moment we arrived. I firmly believe that every staff member is committed to making your stay a truly pleasurable experience and they showed it! The rooms are extremely clean and spacious. Ate at both Amaya and Addison - delicious but not spectacular. The spa is not to be missed! If you do not leave relaxed, you have way too much stress in your life!! GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jewelArizona
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you become the Queen (King). The one bedroom suite is perfect for 2 adults, 2 teens as the each half of the room has it's own entrance/exit. You can close the bedroom door and the suite becomes your own. In the morning when the teenagers are asleep you can come and go without disturbing them. Also very pet friendly as they even give you dog beds, bowls and toys for the pups. Service is amazing in every area, everyone there is menat to serve you. They never make you feel that any request is a burden. The prices are very reasonable as I have stayed in so much less for more money. Take a vacation at the Grand Del Mar, you will never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort!”
Reviews.Author: moorech1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a conference at the Hilton Torrey Pines in La Jolla. It is like night and day - the Grand is an incredible play to stay. Service is top notch and it is absolutely gorgeous. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: CAKathryn
Reviews.Content: Everything was just wonderful. The service was outstanding. The gym was fully equipped and clean. The room was pretty and very comfortable. Just a great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: jlucas1016
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a combined business trip and pleasure. This was my second stay and it was even better than I remembered. The buildings and rooms are to die for, but what is even better (besides the food) is the service. And it extends from the first moment you check in to the folks who are cleaning your room. I've been to many other 5 star hotels, but this one is truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning - Absolutely Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: We have travelled around the States quite a bit and have stayed at some very good hotels but I have to say that the Grand del Mar is the best so far. It is not cheap but then again you expect to pay for quality and this hotel has that in abundance. The staff, without exception are polite, attentive and very professional and you feel that nothing is too much trouble. The room was exceptional, we were on the ground floor and had a siiting area outside by the Reflection Pool which was great as the sun was there all morning. We ate at the Amaya, the Lounge Bar and the Clubhouse Grill. The food was of a high quality and reasonably priced. We also took the courtesy limo to eat at a Chinese restaurant in Del Mar. The Concierge arranged everything and even sent us confirmation. I only have two negative comments. On the first night we ate in the Lounge Bar and placed our order with the waiter, after half an hour our food hadn't turned up and we raised it with the waitress. It turned out that the waiter had forgotten to place the order with the kitchen. This was quickly rectified and we weren't charged for the food. My second issue was that at check-out we were charged for some mini-bar items that we did not have, again this was quickly rectified. Overall this place was amazing and I would recommend it anybody.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here three times. Five star experience is every time”
Reviews.Author: mille125
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times. I feel that it is the best hotel in the San Diego area. I have also stayed in St Regis Monarch Beach, Laguna Niguel, Four Season Aviara, Hotel Del, Rancho Valencia, The Westgate, and Hotel Parisi. The service at the Grand Del Mar seems to set it apart from these other fine resorts. There is a free shuttle the runs in a 10-12 mile radius including the beach in Del Mar. The grounds are beautiful. Kudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “THE Nicest Hotel I Can Remember Staying In”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a southern Cali getaway weekend to celebrate a birthday. Our travel agent found us a fantastic package at this hotel which is only 20 minutes from our home in the SD area but it seems like a world away. The hotel is several miles inland from the ocean, north of the city of San Diego. Freeway access is excellent- a mile or two east of I-5. Our package included golf for two, overnight accommodation, breakfast credit, and a certificate to use at the spa. It was an amazing value and I will look for it again. The hotel lobby, library, bar,etc are strikingly handsome and comfortable. The staff could not be any more friendly (in a sincere manner) and helpful. The hotel grounds are immaculate. The room was probably the nicest one I have stayed in. Everything from the room size, furnishings, bed/ bedding, huge tub, marble floor in bathroom, TV's, balcony, and room safe large enough for a laptop were first rate. Seriously, this was nice. Our room had a comfortable patio overlooking (from third floor) the adult pool. The front desk staff asked which newspapers (you get two) we would like in the AM. They sent a nice note and a dessert in honor of the birthday celebration. All the staff members were really gracious and helpful. We had breakfast on the patio of the Amaya restaraunt. We have previously dined at their 5 diamond (pricey but totally worth it) Addison restaurant but did not go there this trip- it is fantastic however. There is also a grill room at the golf course and a coffee bistro that serves light breakfast and lunch in the main part of the hotel. The adult area pool has a large hot tub with these comfortable outdoor mattress lounges to rest on next to the water. The cocktail waitress was attentive and friendly. There is a separately located family pool (three pools including two pools for kids of various sizes/ages). This has its own bar.etc, The golf course actually functions as a private club with access for hotel guests. It is a Tom Fazio design and is a terrific course. We had to take a caddy (part of the package, excluding gratuity). The idea of the caddy was great although ours did not come across as too friendly or interested (perhaps the only negative of the stay) but others may be friendlier. The golf was really great though. Back at the hotel there was complimentary fresh raspberry lemonade and cookies in the lobby to refresh/snack after golf. The Grand Del Mar exceeded all my expectations. Honestly, I cannot remember staying anywhere that I found more pleasant. I don't usually gush during my reviews.... ok, I'm gushing in this one. Even though this property is so close to home, we will definitely go back for another stay at home vacation.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Details, You'll Love The Grand Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: planourtrip
Reviews.Content: One of the best stays I've add, either on business or personal travel. We went with our family (4 total, two kids aged 8 and 11). The kids were indifferent, but my wife and I loved it. Couple of examples about the details - the elevators are programmed to go to and stay open on floors 1 and 3 so there is no wait, the hallway doors have an extra trim piece that sound proofs the room, the coffee has chicory added to it, the common area bathroom stalls have floor to ceiling doors, etc. That's just the simple stuff, this place has been so well thought out and planned that the list of details would be endless. I'd compare it to the Phoenix Biltmore in terms of quality (the interior at Grand Del Mar is better, the landscaping at the Biltmore is more striking because of the desert surroundings). If you like attention to detail and *****, you'll love The Grand Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelnextX61
Reviews.Content: This is a Grand place to stay at, the rooms were lovely and modern, all the staff were very nice and very helpful. Only complaint is the room service food, they had a great selection, but had many problems with the orders before it was right. The pool and spa was very nice. We look forward to going back one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not for families.”
Reviews.Author: loudab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Del Mar with my three teens. While the staff is lovely and the rooms well appointed, this is not the place for my family. We were there during a relative cold snap. My kids swam in the pool, but then came inside and thought they would check out the game room. They returned to my room after a few minutes. "Mom, it's 15 bucks an hour per kid--too expensive." And they were right. $45 an hour for my three teens to play X-Box? We went out to the hotel's family friendly restaurant, Amaya, for dinner. Again, the staff was superb. But the food was just OK and the prices slightly high. I suspect the food at the Addison, the adult dining spot in the resort, would be much better. Additionally, the drive to downtown San Diego is close to 30 to 45 minutes depending on traffic. All in all, this is not the place I would stay were I coming to San Diego with kids. I can see that it would be a lovely place for a honeymooning couple, but, for a family, I'd stay in a Kimpton Hotel over this in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a San Diego "staycation"”
Reviews.Author: sclori
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to The Grand for my birthday, and we live in San Diego. Not only is the property breathtaking, with views on to the golf course and stunning architecture, but the service, food, rooms....everything was really perfect. If I were traveling to San Diego, looking for a great family place, or a place to enjoy a romantic couple's getaway, The Grand would be a perfect fit. They have a family pool, but we chose the adult pool for a quiet, relaxing afternoon. For locals looking for a quick luxury getaway...it is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best --absolute luxury and magnificence”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: the grand del mar is one of the truly 5 star hotel which exudes opulence and luxury. this is our 3rd stay with them and each time, the staff recognizes us and welcomes us with such warmth and open hearts. one is always made to feel like such importance ...everyone is so so friendly , absolutely no pretentiousness or stuffiness about the property at all. the rooms are to die for , the grounds are immaculately gorgeous, and the pools are beautiful and soothing. we love the grand del mar so much that we are always so depressed when we have to check out. the grand del mar exceeds any ritz, 4 seasons, fairmonts, and st regis hotels that we have stayed in. it is truly a hidden gem in del mar ! the resort should deserve a 20 out of 10 for everything and anything !!!! we thank you, grand del mar, for bringing such luxury to all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: luxury5500
Reviews.Content: ﻿This was my second stay here. BEAUTIFUL and LUXURIOUS!!! Everything about this hotel is perfect. From checking in with the professional front desk staff to the bell men to the restaurant staff.The rooms are meticulous as well as the entire hotel and grounds. It is a paradise, you won't want to leave! The golf coarse is breath taking and quite a challenge :), but I LOVE GOLF, so I am up for it anytime, anywhere. Anywhere we went there was always some one to ask if we needed anything. They have so much to offer, full spa,fitness center,quite pools, pool area with a bar, small and romantic Jacuzzis and quiet places to sit and enjoy the amazing views. This is definitely a place to visit, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place. An old world feel with all the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: WLAMom
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the fanciest hotels we've been to in a long time. Most places opt for the more modern look now, but this is just the opposite. It reminds me of a by-gone era, and service was impeccable. The decor is a little heavy with the gilded look, but hey, I'm not complaining. Like others mentioned, there were very few people while we were there. Not sure if it's due to the price or location. It is a wee bit far from civilization - definitely cannot walk anywhere. For folks with small children, I think they may be bored since we didn't see anything obvious for small kids other than the pool, a very immaculate pool. We ate at the outdoors patio, and the food was quite good, and not as expensive as I had thought. Service was prompt, but again, we were one of only 2 parties there. The resort is huge, so we did not see it all. Next time, I'll make a point to visit the spa. It looks scrumptous. It would be a really good place for a girls get away.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in attentive service”
Reviews.Author: art89
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Grand Del Mar. I have stayed at some of the top hotels of the world and the the Grand Del Mar ranks with any of them. The rooms are all magnificent. The grounds are beautiful and extensive enough to take an hour jog and never leave the hotel paths. Most impressive is the concierge service. The desk is staffed from early morning to late at night with a group of the most knowledgable, smiling and attentive people I have met in any of my travels. There seemed to be nothing they couldn't or wouldn't do. When they overheard my daughter mention to me that her kids missed having a dvd player for the TV for naps, one happened to appear in her room. I cannot compliment them enough. And they were right about every restaurant and attraction they sent us to. The staff throughout the hotel was equally attentive and pleasant. The restaurants were wonderful, without being "snobbish". This is simply what every hotel strives for.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay"”
Reviews.Author: BCrutch
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Grand Del Mar for business and for pleasure with my six year old son. We stayed for five nights leading into Thanksgiving 2009. Most importantly to me, the staff here treated my son like he was a special guest. They could not have been more accomodating, kind or kid friendly. This includes the golf staff who were wonderful. My son continues to rave about his trip and is the best promoter of this resort walking in New Jersey!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing can be better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: This place is the most amazing place I have been. Travelling a lot, being to many hotels, this hotel is the best of the best I have ever been. The grounds are beautiful, the hotel is well built and beautifully decorated. I don't see any flaw in this hotel. Everything was perfect, even the prices of drinks and food was reasonable. There is this great cafe where you can have your morning coffee with a nice pastry or sandwich for a very reasonable prices. The staff is very nice and professional. The hotel is priced really cheap for what you get. I will definitely return! and I recommend this hotel to everyone that wants a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...Great Service...Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Griff88
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say, without reservation, that my rating of this hotel is neither exaggerated nor underrated. This was the best hotel I have ever stay in. The place was spotless, from the drive up the long road, to the valet, to the front desk and lobby, to the hallway and finally our room. Our three night stay was for our honeymoon and a gift from a family member who has time share in one of the Villas at the Grand Del Mar. It was just awesome. We had room service two or three times and the food was great, though pricey, worth it to splurge for our honeymoon. The staff was very welcoming and made everything perfect. I highly recommend The Grand Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts in the world!!”
Reviews.Author: snakesonplane
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe how wonderful this resort is...me and my husband stayed a night for the bed n' breakfast package and we were so enchanted by everything. It reminds me of Bellagio in las vegas but with no noisy casino and crowds. The resort is beautiful, well maintained, quiet, comfortable and the staff treats you like royalty. Rooms - Beautiful gold gilded large rooms with very comfortable bed, lovely deep soaking tub!! Large HD TV and great amenities. Food - I had dinner at "Amaya" in the hotel and I have to say it was probably the best food I have ever eaten in my life. I recommend the Chef's Course for Dinner. It's $40, which is actually affordable and very delicious. My favorite was the Concord grape ice cream with the chocolate and peanut butter waffer for dessert. Didn't get to try the 5 diamond "Addison" restaurant but i'm sure it's excellent as well. Staff - I was wow'ed by the service at this resort. Concierge emailed me a few days ahead asking if they can assist me with planning activities or making reservations. I was very impressed. Front desk staff were super polite and accommodating! Overall - Even though the price tag is a bit heftier than most resorts, but I think it's worth every penny. There aren't many places like this and it is truly a hidden gem in San Diego. I wish I had my honeymoon / wedding there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: ianbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I received a free night from Hotels.com after staying 10 nights elsewhere over the past year. We chose the fanciest five-star hotel in San Diego, the Grand Del Mar. We stayed between Christmas and New Years, expecting a crowd, but the hotel felt rather empty. Nonetheless, the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself is part of a resort that includes a world-class golf course, four swimming pools, a spa, at least two restaurants and a comfortable lounge. Our room was by far the most plush, luxurious entry-level room we've ever experienced. The bed was heavenly, with down pillows and turn-down service. The flat-screen HDTV was huge. Our bathroom featured marble counter tops, a sunken tub, separate large shower and even a television. We loved the Grand Del Mar!

Reviews.Title: “One Word.......AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlondieOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible experience at the Grand Del Mar!!! It is a relaxing, romantic, secluded luxury hotel that was above and beyond our expectations!!! *The Valet and bell service were top notch. Very helpful and hard working. *Our room was amazing. Very spacious, beautifully appointed, soft down comforter, soft carpeting. *The bathroom was very impressive!! The size alone was outstanding! There is a huge, deep bathtub with great water pressure and lots of hot water. Two sinks and lots of counterspace. Many drawers to put away your bathroom stuff. I loved the bath gel from the spa. Smells great. A large closet/sitting area. A large seperate toilet area. Towels were upscale also. *Fitness center was one of the best I've ever been to at a hotel. Large space---not cramped at all----and very beautiful room too! No charge to use. I think there was every piece of fitness equipment you could ever need for a good workout there. Lots of treadmills and ellipticals with their own individual tv's. Very nice! Never crowded. They put free bottled water on every machine too. Spa is beautiful. Did not receive any services but wanted to! There is a Cafe that serves coffee, mocha's, has pastries, cookies, bagel, sells cokes, water, and has very yummy gelato. We used the cafe every day and loved it! The people that work there are SO nice too. The pool area is beautiful and we would have laid out and used the pool had the weather been warmer. We had room service twice during our stay, and it was outstanding. They told us it would be there in 30 minutes, and it was there 30 minutes on the dot! Very fresh and hot! *The attention to detail in this resort is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: captainswife
Reviews.Content: We were there for our 15 wedding anniversary and couldn't have had better experience. The rooms were huge and beautifully decorated. We stay at the Four Seasons resorts mostly and these rooms were just as luxurious, if not more so. They upgraded our room for free since it was a weekday and they were not crowded. We ate at the Addison Restaurant that was extremely pricey but it's not the kind of restaurant you would eat at every day and certainly worthy of a special occasion. The service and the Chef's Choice menu were excellent. They sent complimentary Champagne and chocolate to our room and Housekeeping was quick to respond to every request. I am concerned that this hotel doesn't get as much publicity as it should and, therefore is not as busy as it needs to be to stay profitable. We are hoping to return for another visit this summer to try out the pool and other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “"Unforgettable Memories"”
Reviews.Author: twashme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the fabulous Grand Del Mar on April 18th 2009 and what a great time we had. Everything was absolutely amazing. Not one complaint. Our friends/family couldn't stop ranting and raving about how beautiful everything was. The staff is phenomenal. Every five star hotel should offer this kind of service. Mr. and Mrs. Washington

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, can't imagine how they stay in business”
Reviews.Author: wjr06831
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Stayed here with our 3 young kids over Spring Break in connecting rooms. Hotel was at maybe 40% occupancy according to one bell man, although it looked even emptier than that. Beautiful grounds - very extensive and well maintained. Property looks very well built - rooms were quiet, spacious, and everything was well put together. The bathrooms were big and the kids loved the fact that there was a TV in there. The bedrooms were big, the beds were among the best I have ever slept on, and as mentioned the build quality was very impressive. Did not hear any noise from other rooms or the hallway once during our stay. Good location - close to highway so easy to get into San Siego proper or go up to Legoland for example. Pools were great, especially as they were almost deserted. One of them had water playing underwater and the kids got a kick out of dropping underwater to listen to it. We also got a good deal through American Express. Can't think of anything that could realistically have been better. Will definitely stay there next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms & View GREAT, Breakfast Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Jens1974
Reviews.Content: Good: Rooms are great. We had one facing the golf course - beautiful. Service very professional. Location itself is very nice, but not that close to La Jolla, Downtown etc. Bad: Only one thing...breakfast was terrible. Fruits NOT freshly slized (despite saying so on menu). Joghurt average supermarket quality at best. Belgian waffle semi baked. Waiter not caring. What made it worse: All other hotel breakfasts we had on the vacation (at FS, Casa del Mar & Wynn) were great. BUT: Front-desk did not charge us for breakfast. And hotel manager promised to look after issue.

Reviews.Title: “little overgilded,but five star”
Reviews.Author: judge1
Reviews.Content: a little too much stuff,but the people were great,the restaurants all we needed,the golf is superb...we think this property may be under appreciated...we travel quite a bit and seek quality...we found it here,even with the gilded stuff...if i had a complaint i would say it is too much like a four seasons or ritz carlton...we preferred it to the lodge at torrey pines where went went when we left...a big hotel,not busy,the staff treated us well.

Reviews.Title: “Great leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: ShawnCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with first class service. I don't see how anyone can write the service was poor at this hotel. Everyone seemed very friendly and really went out of their way to help us. We were originally scheduled for a one day stay. After staying one day (Sunday), we left the hotel for a two day stay at the Ritz Carlton in Dana Point (ocean view room). While the view of the beach was great, the older rooms at the Ritz Carlton don't compare to the rooms of the Grand Del Mar. The Grand Del Mar rooms are first class. They have free internet service, beautiful furniture, great televisions, super nice bathrooms, and in room mini bars. We ended up leaving one day early from the Ritz Carlton and returned to the Grand Del Mar. At the Grand Del Mar, we had a fairway view room both days that was great (standard king room). Our $435.00 package (room was a little more because of fairway view) included a $65 breakfast credit and free valet parking. The second day we got the same room for $325.00 with no breakfast credit. You should be aware that San Diego has a 12.5 percent hotel/resort tax that gets added to your bill. I didn't play golf this trip, but I will next time. I never saw a lot of players on the course. I believe it would be a great course to play because it looks like a top notch course and I doubt there would be much of a wait between holes. The fitness center was really nice with a lot of high end equipment. The pools and grounds are beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCA09
Reviews.Content: Guests of a wedding, and didn't want to leave! Most beautiful hotel in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at The Grand Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: Jackielynn1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary at The Grand Del Mar. It was absolutely amazing! Treatments at the spa followed by a relaxing afternoon and lunch at the pool was simply perfect. The pool attendents make sure your every want and need is attended to. The entire staff is wonderful and very welcoming. We've already booked our next visit for December to celebrate my birthday. I'm looking forward to making this our yearly getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it's best”
Reviews.Author: lv4maui
Reviews.Content: We went for a quiet getaway and we're very impressed with this hotel. The rooms are spacious and elegant. The adult pool is luxurious with comfortable padded lounge chairs, underwater music, and frozen grapes. Sunscreen, magazines and cold water always available. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkdjm
Reviews.Content: This was our 'home' during our visit to Comicon. The rooms we spacious and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was magnificent. As beautiful as the hotel is, the staff was so much more. They bend over backwards to accommodate any of needs while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Serene setting - amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: attymom
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful & lovely. Relaxing. Free wi-fi, free water bottles,free valet parking. HUGE closet. 2nd TV in bathroom. Delux furniture. Beautiful pools. All surrounded by an award-winning golf course and very green rolling hills of Torrey Pine Reserve. A great bike trail and walking trail. A mere few minutes to a very swim-able beach. It felt so far away and relaxing. Having spent a couple of weeks in Europe this past summer, I felt a renewed appreciation for what we have right here in so. cal - nature, uncrowded beaches... The Grand has an amazing staff. Very helpful in every which way without imposing. Loved the stay. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf, great resort”
Reviews.Author: partrip1
Reviews.Content: If you desire a more detailed report, please go to www.partrip.com Briefly, the place is new, great food, great service. The golf is awesome and the scenery is great. The current rate of $395 a night is superb, really can't beat that. Place is not stuck up, very comfy feel, despite all the opulence.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: hotnanny
Reviews.Content: Just got back from The Grand Del Mar, and can't wait to go back! It is truly the best hotel the Hubby and I have ever stayed at, including concierge level at The Venetian in Las Vegas. Our room was beautiful, the tub huge, fab mattress/linens, great service from the staff- and amazing grounds! We had a 3 night package deal, that included valet- and a $100 resort credit. I used it at the spectacular looking spa. I prefer the services at the Glen Ivy Day Spa, but the relaxation rooms are incredibly appointed. Our view was overlooking the croquet garden. High Tea was intimate in the Library, with great food/service. Loved the adult only pool/jacuzzi- complete with pool boys/girls. You will feel very pampered. :-) I do not hesitate to recommend this 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: DrSurf
Reviews.Content: It's nice on the exterior however it has very poor customer service, very expensive, and over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Learning lessons from high-end chains”
Reviews.Author: seagulls77
Reviews.Content: A tremendous hotel, the like of which we would never see in Europe (certainly not at this price). Space, comfort, well equipped rooms, a choice of pools, an impressive spa and a well-equipped gym with a consistently high quality standard of service throughout. Details have been looked after and lessons learned from the sometimes antiseptic feel of the high-end chains. The food is excellent with the Addison worth a visit in itself. The golf course is fantastically maintained and tuition is hands-on and effective. An instant favourite

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for Opening Day at Del Mar. This place is so beautiful we almost passed up going to Opening Day just to enjoy the hotel more. The attention to detail is out of this world. From the customer service to the beautiful rooms, everything was fantastic. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world and this ranks as one of the best I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jaybee27
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin with this hotel, we ended up checking out two days earlier than we were due to. To start they put a holding charge of $6000 on our credit card for incidentals eh hello?? most hotels put $100 dollars max on. They never informed us they were doing this, which then ended up taking a whole 8 days to go back onto our credit card.. Next the hotel room was beyond tacky with all the faux gold fittings on everything and the real old fashioned curtains which wouldn't even block out the light properly, our view was of nothing practically. Hotel was full of screaming kids which totally put me off we were on our honeymoon obviously wanting to have some r&r, kids running up and down the corridors every morning waking us, screaming and running all over the restaurants. So off putting especially when you are paying like $495+ a night here. I rang the front desk to explain our concerns and express our unhappiness with all the noise from children etc, they were not one bit helpful or offering us alternative accommodation in the hotel, so i informed them we would be checking out two days earlier. On check out day the guy at the front desk was nothing but down right rude to us. I was just so disappointed this was part of our honeymoon and they'd taken the good out of it for us. I would not recommend this "over the top" hotel to anybody..

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a find”
Reviews.Author: luxtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical when we booked this for a 4 night stay with the family. How could a hotel that is not on the beach be a good place to stay? However we were all blown away by the plushness, value, size of rooms, quality of food (from all of the on property restaurants), and proximity to the beaches in Del Mar. The quality of materials used to build this hotel was impressive with no shortcuts found anywhere. I didn't play golf this time but the Fazio designed track is really impressive (the golf carts are even mini Bentley's!). A lot of times in high end resorts there is an attitude with the staff, however everyone here from the pool service, front desk, and valet where extremely nice, helpful and friendly. There is a beach shuttle available however we just drove everyday and they still provided us with ice and beach towels. Also have to mention that it was super quiet in our room so we had a good sleeping experience. Going back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for Families”
Reviews.Author: kateinthesun
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at The Grand Del Mar from the 8th July. It was the perfect place to have a vacation with our 5-year old children. The Grounds of this Hotel are breathtaking. The scenery is lush and interesting, and the Hotel itself is extremely luxurious. We booked a Prado Suite and were blown away by the two huge "Master" Bathrooms. They really add a "wow" factor to the Suite. High quallity furnishings throughout the property. Our children enjoyed the well stocked Explorer's Club and Adriana and her team do a great job with their young charges. There are a vast assortment of restaurants within a short distance from the property, and LEGOLAND and the Zoo are about 25 minute drive. We enjoyed breakfast every morning at AMAYA. The food quality was consistently good, but not exceptional. Yes, the Hotel is definitely grand and beautiful, but the most impressive part of it, is the SERVICE! The Concierge Team is terrific. I asked Lynette about tickets for LEGOLAND, she not only gave me prices and directions, she printed out all of the height restrictions for the various rides, so my 5-year olds could plan their day! Eugenia & Samuel were equally helpful, all of the time. We had just spent 5 nights at the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco and I would say the Concierge Team at this property far exceeded the service level offered at the Ritz. The Children found lovely toys waiting for them in the Room when we checked in, and their names spelt out in bath sponges, which thrilled them. Every day, we received an edible treat in our Suite. Fruit, chocolates, macaroons... Bryan, the Greeters and the Valet Guys were always courteous, gave great restaurant recommendations and offered cold bottled water whenever we got into our car. The Family Pool area was also enjoyable. Wish I had the time for a Spa trip, but hopefully on our next visit. I had previously booked the Four Seasons Aviara for this trip, and then changed our reservations to the Grand Del Mar. I am absolutely confident I made the best decision for our entire family, we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
